Summary: Make sure when you check in you check the peepholes in the door Of your room.  In Our room, it was missing and you could see into the room with the door closed. The building is older and you get what you pay for, but the bed was comfortable. Overall not horrible but definitely didn’t feel comfortable knowing someone could pop the cover placed over the peephole and look in.

I chose this facility because of the convenient location to Disneyland and good value during our stay. But I did not anticipate the noise and the extremely uncomfortable mattress. We did not get a good night sleep during our stay.

I wish I read the reviews before I stayed.  I booked two nights.  I went to wash my face the first night, and the towels were stained.  Not just one.  Yellow protein stains...like from a teenagers room.  I ended up using the towel in my Jeep after my shower.   I booked two nights....and left after the first night.  It was that bad. Also...unlike what the website says, there is NO pool and NO breakfast.  So plan accordingly.

Very outdated , need newer furniture , elevator was very smelly (like oil) good thing there was only 3 floors. House keeping didn’t even come to throw trash out. Phone looked so dirty didn’t want to touch it.

would not stay here again.  ac units super dirty.  curtains block ac flow.  dirty towel in stairwell all 4 days.  lock on room was broken.  blood or rust stain on towels.   could watch the backside of disneyland fireworks show from room

Do not stay in this property, everything is rusting, very old, smelly and not clean. I did not even spend an hour here and just booked a new hotel. Well of course they charged us $200 one night since we cancel it.

Do not stay at the Days Inn in Anaheim. There were cockroaches in the room. Also, the internet did not work and there was no breakfast available, even though it states it on the reservation. Spend a little extra money and stay somewhere else.

Call hotel directly to check on amenities available and if breakfast (stated included in stay) will be available so you can plan on if you are going to have to pay for breakfast at a nearby restaurant or not

OMG! The worst. No breakfast, no matter what the site says!! Want cash deposit of $200. Rooms are not worth it. Beds are super uncomfortable!! The sheets and mattress protector constantly popped off and we got to see the mattress...  So gross! Will not enjoy your stay!

Had a reservation to stay here for 4 nights this past weekend.  There was no free breakfast as advertised on their website and every travel booking site.   Their towels were old, ripped, and permanently stained.   There was a mysterious, slimey wet spot on the floor that never dried in the 4 nights we stayed.  Half of the lights did not work, even though they were plugged in.  Front office staff were friendly but unfortunately the rooms were still terrible.  We had to call every single day for clean towels because we were never given enough.  Splurge and spend the extra money on a different hotel.

Room is old. Towels ripped. Everything looked dirty. No problem with shower. No breakfast served but it was advertised.  Would not recommend for a family. Would not stay here again. AC worked OK and had the extra room. Room OK for the price.

Summary Heading: "Danger Keep Out" Sign right next to our room
Summary: We didn't even stay. We got the key, went to the room and we were greet with a "Danger Keep out. Enter this area can expose you to lead from lead acid batteries. Lead is known to the state of california to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm." sign on the door next to ours. I don't know what happened into a hotel room to get that kind of warning.   If that wasn't enough, we opened the room and it looked like it was never cleaned.Espically when we are living in a pandemic, you want to feel safe and that the hotel managers are cleaning the rooms so they don't look like a murder scene.   We immediately canceled our room and found somewhere else to stay. Did not feel safe or comfortable. I honestly can't believe that they would even put someone next to that

Summary Heading: Great Value for a really close hotel to Disneyland
Summary: It was a good stay for us. Everything around is within just minutes of drive or walkable. Disneyland parking is just about 5 mins drive. We get a great view of the fireworks display outside our room. This place is not fancy but clean and doable to stay.

Room’s ceiling was a mess, no breakfast. The website advertises breakfast and when you get there they tell you there is no breakfast, and it’s too late to cancel at that point. The shower head was really low, I’m 5’6 and I had to lean down Todd water to reach my head.

Was not impressed with the appearance of the hotel or the room. Was impressed with the location of this hotel, 10 minute walk to theme parks. Website stated breakfast was included in price and this was not the case.

This is your average motel but it is by far one of the cheapest places to stay in the Disney area of Anaheim. I have now styed here 3 times and its been great every time. The staff is pleasant and the rooms are decent and a great place to rest before long days at Disney. The walk into the parks is not bad and it saves you time and money with not having to park. The rooms are a bit outdated but to me it doesnt matter because this is just a place to sleep and shower. The rooms are always decently clean and they provide a fridge and microwave so you are able to store items for breakfast. Overall i will keep coming back to this motel because it never fails me!

Drugs in the premises such as marijuana smell in the hallway. Weak wifi connection. And hard to navigate and parking was so tight at all. Place is so dark, cctv is present but doesn’t look like working for the safety

What a bad expecience. First I got a room that smelled like straight up cigarette everywhere when I clearly booked a non smoking room...at the end I went and talked to the receptionist and  I got another room. Now in this room, the header did not work at all and It was a cold night! The sink got stuck and didn’t work at all..: not TV cable at all. Room was overall dirty. Bad pillows. Horrible breakfast. Bad experience. Never again getting a room a this place

Summary Heading: Great hotel service and accessibility to parks! Yes I will stay here again!
Summary: Arrived fairly early to the hotel to get in some park time, and the very friendly clerk let us park in the lot before checkin. We came back around 530pm to checkin and were in and out in about 5min.  This was great for me because I have 2 little ones who get bored real quick. This is an older hotel, but it is inexpensive, clean room, view of fireworks (over the tops of trees), walkable to/from park (.9mi)/tram (.5mi)/downtown Disney (.7mi).  Rooms are not upgraded, but they are clean and comfortable, proximity to the park is awesome.  Easy to get to, but it is on main crossroads so watch your kids.

We booked at this hotel so that we could enjoy a nice stay with our kids for Disneyland. We get there the first night and the elevator smells horrible. I actually held my breathe the entire time I was in it and then decided I rather use the stairs. We walk in and the room looked fine until we used the bathroom. Boogers smeared on the wall next to the toilet. Shower head was so low we had to duck to use. I am 5'8 and my husband 6'0. Towels were very unpleasant to use. They were like sand paper. Sheets had yellow spots all over them. The refrigerator smelled horrible. And didn't look clean. Tried to use the drawers and the drawers were dirty and smelled horrible as well. Something rotten. I get in bed and look over and the wall had something green splattered all over it. Walls

Stayed in a King bed room, with myself and my boyfriend while visiting Disneyland for 3 days. Basic motel style room, but with a fridge and microwave which was very handy for storing snacks, and meals after a long day at Disneyland.  The room was clean, but did get quite warm during the day if the aircon was not left on, and the pillows were not very comfortable. It is at the back of Disneyland, so a tip is to walk to the Pixar Pals/Mickey & Friends parking garage, and get on the free tram to the main entrance of the park. Ends up being a 10 min walk, instead of 20.  Would stay again, but definitly need more improvement in regards to breakfast quality, and linen.

We decided to go to Disneyland on short notice and most of the hotels were sold out. We found Days Inn had availability and they price was right even though it was short notice. It is located right by the back entrance of the Disneyland parking garage. However, it is to far to walk to Disney (about a 20 minute walk, that's what Maps stated at least), so we still had to drive and pay for parking. The rooms were moderate, nothing fancy, but clean and met the need for showering and sleeping. We did not check out the continental breakfast.

It was a great location & the room size is amazing.  However, it smelled like stale socks and urine.  The carpet was so dirty that if you walked bare-footed your feet were black because of the dirty carpet.  Basically, it was a bed to sleep in.  But even that, the pillows were the size of couch throw pillows and not at all comfortable.

Summary Heading: Average hotel but great location if you’re going to Disneyland
Summary: We got 2 rooms to share between 8 people. I don’t know if it’s normal for the restroom door to not close or lock completely but that sucked. I shared my room with another couple and had to announce when we were going in before hand to avoid any awkward opening of doors. Pillows were not at all comfortable but after a long day at Disneyland it didn’t matter. Breakfast was okay. Check in and check out went smoothly.

Summary Heading: Decent budget hotel near Disney and Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I was in Anaheim for VidCon, and booked this place thinking it was the other Days Inn at which I'd stayed. I was surprised to see there was no pool and no exercise room, since the other nearby Days Inn has one. It appears they used to have a pool (from the maps on the wall), but it's gone now. All in all, it was fine - within very short driving, or about maybe 15-30 minute walking distance of Disney and the Anaheim Convention Center.   The WiFi was good, room lighting, heating and cooling were sufficient, and it was reasonably quiet on the second floor. There was a miniridge and a microwave, and a TV. The fridge worked fine; I didn't use the TV or the microwave. here was an ice machine and a cheap (75 cents to wash, also 75 cents to dry) coin laundry there. The washer and dryer

Will recommend this place to friends and family. Very convenient and close to the park. Will stays here again. 15 minutes Walking to Disneyland if you need a place to sleep and go to the park, this is your place

Summary Heading: Excellent Price, Clean, And Close To Disneyland
Summary: This Days Inn is close to Disneyland and only a 1/5 mile walk. They're one of the cleanest motels in the area that isn't so extremely overpriced. The last time we booked with Wyndham points website; I found out they have 3 queen size bed rooms available, and it's roomy! It's clean! Did I say that before?  Well, I have to reiterate, it's clean.  They sealed up the pool and jacuzzi for more parking spaces; so, that'll be missed.  They've got continental breakfast in the morning; muffins, cereal, milk, toast and jams, and if you're running a little late, they are wonderful at letting you have extra time.  The best thing of all is you can see the nightly Disney fireworks from your room but, just remember if you have an alarm on your car; it'll be going off until the show is over. :)

Horrible place to stay!  The only fix here is to demolish this forsaken-awful place.  Seriously, the #1 worst hotel cringe experience I have ever had.  I am not picky and can appreciate trade-offs for value.  However, this place is not accurate as advertised.  Small beds, terrible mattress, rubber pillows, damp gross carpet, itchy sheets, nasty old paper thin towels I would be embarrassed to give to Goodwill, stained (not kidding) bedspreads, small TV, door to bathroom and outside leaves gap, furniture that should be thrown out.  Would not stay here for free!  In fact, left after first night of 2 day reservation with ZERO sleep.  RUINED Disney vacation!  That this is part of a national chain and can be this DISGUSTING is appalling!  Oh, and breakfast... 2 cereal choices and

Summary Heading: Good location, but not much else...
Summary: Location, location, location...about the only good thing this hotel has to offer, being within such close walking distance of Disneyland. Otherwise, dingy, a bit musty, and not much to speak of. The continental breakfast is lame even by free continental breakfast standards.

Summary Heading: Great value and even better service
Summary: Accommodations were pleasant - not fancy but for the price, well worth it. Service was excellent and kindness goes a long way for me.  I liked being able to sleep six in a large room with three beds.  Really made it economical.

We love this hotel! Right at the park entrance to Disney and it's affordable and clean. I also feel safe there which is a huge plus. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The only downfall is their lack of selection for breakfast. But we usually bring our own stuff so no biggie.

I do not recommend this hotel at all. Save your money and look somewhere else. The doors did not close properly. We had to put a chair to close the door. They would not give us our money back. Even when I complained.

Worst experience ever! If I could give it negative stars I would. I live in southern California and spring break with my in laws from Idaho every year. This year we went to Disneyland for the first 3 days of vacation. We stayed at this hotel because it was close by. There is no shuttle or public transportation by the hotel to Disney. This was disappointing,  but not a huge deal. However, the nice pool and spa that they have pictured on their website was fenced off, empty,  and surrounded by broken up concrete. When you are traveling from cold weather to warm weather, having a pool is a big deal.  All the kids were super disappointed. The first room I was given was missing a bed. The second room I was given was okay. The bedding is super thin and not very comfortable. The

Walked in to a car air freshener hanging over the bed, filthy rooms, items stolen from another family memebers room then the manager placed blame on our family for the missing items. Called our family member profanities when she called to see if the items had been turned in. Garbage pushed under the bed from previous stays was found by my 5 year old niece looking for a toy she dropped off the bed. Pool and hot tub was full of broken concrete. Really terrible experience. If you have to stay here just remember to lock up your valuables the staff has sticky fingers!!!

Full view of the fireworks! Five start view of the show for a small price.  Stayed here for two nights just for a place to sleep while we spent our whole days at Disney. Walking distance to Disney (roughly 15 minute walk to downtown Disney). Super safe walkway from hotel to Disney.   Room is what you pay for. Don’t listen to the negative reviews- this place is absolutely fine! Clean room, towels, sheets and had all the basic needs. Breakfast is limited but shops are all walking distance.   Would definitely recommend this place. Would come back !

Summary Heading: JUST ENOUGH TO GET THERE TO SLEEP AND SHOWER EVERY DAY
Summary: Very little breakfast (almost nothing to choose from, NO ORANGE JUICE, NO BREAD, NO BUTTER, NO JAM, AND SEVERAL TIMES THEY RUN OUT OF MILK) and kind of clean but not enough. THE ATTENTION WAS NICE and the room had a round table we used a lot. TV AND INTERNET OK.

We knew we would be spending most of our waking hours in the parks, so we didn’t really feel like we needed anything fancy. We stayed here for four nights for around $400 including taxes - just about what one night would cost in one of the park hotels on the same night. Breakfast was carb heavy — cereal, muffins, and oatmeal. We took a couple extra muffins as emergency park snacks.  The tram at the theme park parking garage was a ten minute walk, and the security lines were almost non-existent — this saved us time compared to going through security by the park entrance. We used the tram every morning, and ubered back to the hotel every night (about a $6 ride from the designated Uber pick up zone.)   Our room was clean, and refreshed every day. The gas station across the street

Hotel was a bit pricey, room was spacious and clean, restroom itself was small but the fridge size was great along with microwave.  The maids were very attentive, friendly and went out of their way.  Not recommended for anyone wanting peace and quite the hotel is very family orientated and wall's are not too thick so we could hear the baby crying next door plus we had someone that needed the first floor or elevator which worked when we checked in but upon leaving the hotel had an "Out of Order" sign taped on elevator buttons making it difficult to get downstairs.

It's convenient to Disney, but not worth the money or points. Breakfast is prepackaged. Nothing healthy, no fruit. It is in deperate need of maintenance, repair and cleaning. It really needs to be remodeled. It's not just old though it is gross. Portion of our sink were missing as it is just rusted out. The caulk in the bathroom so thick and pealing. Shower didn't fully work (water came out the bottom spout as well as the top). It's not worth it even if you are only there in the event to sleep. The beds are horribly uncomfortable. they use top sheets as bottom sheets so I we couldn't even get the bedding to stay on. I love Days Inn, but this is not only the worst Days Inn I've stayed in, its the worst hotel I've stayed in ever. Only positive thing I have to say is that there

Very close to Disneyland!! The room was fantastic and clean, the staff was friendly, and the beds were comfortable. My only complaint was that the breakfast didn't have much of a selection, but it def. did the job.

The hotel was ok until the last night! On the last night we found a used condom underneath the bed! Either the hotel staff was gettin it on while we were at the park or the hotel staff failed to clean the rooms properly! Also, carpets are extremely dirty. My sons white socks were black on the bottom after and hour of walking around on them. If you can look past that, the. Maybe this is the hotel for you. Location is great for walking to Downtown Disney and driving to the parking garage.

Summary Heading: Disney Fireworks from my Front Door!
Summary: The Days Inn was clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The staff members were very polite and helpful.  If one is going to Disney, it's a short walk....Gas station across the street has souvenirs, snacks, etc.

It was a short walk to the tram station into Disneyland. I felt as a female, it was safe in t :) e daylight and evening hours. The rooms could use some updating (I.e Mattresses), but overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Best price for an awesome place!
Summary: Within 10min walking distance of downtown disney, had a gas station across the street for needed gas or quick foods, and it was close to many food shops. The staff was super friendly, even the staff that did the gardening and such. The hotel is a little warn but nothing that will ever trouble you. Best experience for an amazing price! 10/10 would come again!!

Good overall stay. The bed could have been more comfortable, but everything else was met. The service was prompt and clean, the Air Condition worked well, and we were able to check in very late at night which was helpful

Been here for one night The pool and hot tub are not clean The room is ok  But we had problems with the bathroom  Breakfast... is very poor In one word: no Find a batter place for your money look for other place around

Check your towels before using them. There was caked on brown stuff on more than one of the washcloths and the bedding smelled awful. Its convenient for disney travelers because of the distance from the park but other than that this hotel had nothing going for it

Summary Heading: Just what we wanted on a budget :)
Summary: It's a quick 15-minute walk to Disneyland and we saved a bunch of money staying here. The room is fine, we spent 15-16 hours in the parks and just slept there which is what we planned.   Sure it's far from fancy and could use quite a few upgrades (the shower curtain doesn't even fit) but whatever. The sheets were clean and the key worked.

Room was fine. Breakfast was available as advertised. The hotel is right next to Disneyland, so you get a free view of the nightly fireworks show. We walked to and from the parks with a 5 and 9 year old.

Summary Heading: A Decent Place to Stay at Close to Disneyland
Summary: My family was looking for a cheap hotel close to Disneyland Park. This place fits the bill. It’s next door to the Mickey & Friends parking structure. You could walk to the park but it looks like it’s not the shortest walk or easy to find. The hotel is decent and has a complementary breakfast. It’s just mini muffins and coffee but free is free. We’d grab some extra and put them in our bags for a snack in the park. The room was about as basic as they come. It did have a fridge that way nice when we ate in Downtown Disney and had leftovers. The one employee we spoke to was helpful when we checked in. I wasn’t a fan of him telling us we should have called ahead for a rollaway since they were out. I don’t need to know what we should have done just tell me how we’re going to handle

On our last day there was work being done on the balcony railings that began at 8am and they where pounding and welding till 4pm (not a relaxing experience) as we wanted to sleep in after a day at theme park and before long drive back to Vegas, I mentioned to front desk and nothing offered for the inconvenience.  Also the bathtub had a nice size plaster patch about size of softball and edges where sticking up.  Towels are very stiff and no fabric softner on them.

The hotel desperately needs an upgrade. Bathtub backed up, was fixed by the time we returned that evening Parking is awful, not enough spots available per room. Could not get into the room for breakfast. The gentleman up front was nice. Close to Disney. Used lyft 6$

Summary Heading: GREAT STAY FOR THE PRICE AND VERY CLOSE TO PARK
Summary: my family and I stayed there to go on our family Disneyland vacation. room was very clean and big it fit our family of 5 perfectly with room to spare. full amenities like coffee maker, microwave, fridge, blow dryers in rom. and breakfast included. quiet very helpful and accommodating staff I will be returning again. good value for the price.

Summary Heading: Amazing view of the Disneyland fireworks and Very close to...
Summary: Amazing view of the Disneyland fireworks and Very close to Downtown Disney! Rooms were very clean and well kept. The staff was very helpful and professional. Would definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: Our family was in Anaheim to visit Disneyland. The hotel has PERFECT view of the fireworks at Disneyland. The non-smoking room was on the 3rd floor so we got to smell all of the smoke from the guests below us. The beds were extremely comfortable! The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels and sheets. There was some mold/mildew along the floor in the bathroom and the toilet paper was much more like sand paper than toilet paper. The pool is not heated, but looked nice. The hot tub is tiny and had green slime all over the inside, but the kids loved it.... it wasn’t the best hotel we have ever stayed in, but we were going for more econmical and got exactly what we paid for. It is a 45 minute walk to Disneyland! If looking for value, this was a great place. All of the staff we

Summary Heading: 70s COMFORT ON THE EDGE OF DISNEYLAND
Summary: Located at an intersection, with a road (with sidewalk) from that cutting through Disneyland to Katella Ave., within a block of the Anaheim Convention Centre, this is a great location for anyone attending an exhibition at that venue...or visiting Disneyland. There is a petrol station/convenience shop across the street from the hotel for snacks (a fridge int the hotel rooms means you can stock up). Restaurants can be found on nearby Harbour Blvd. (an alternative walking route between the Convention Ctr. and hotel), on Katella and all around the Convention Centre area. The Cheesecake Factory is highly recommended for great meals (wonderful menu) and service at realistic prices. Buca di Beppo on Harbour Blvd. is fantastic - though always busy - for eat-till-you-drop Italian fare.

Room was spacious and clean. Easy checkin. Only issue was we had 2 cars and we were told at Check in that we couldn’t take up 2 spaces due to limited parking. However, we can still park along the wall as long as we leave the car keys at the office.

If your just looking for a quick stay near Disneyland and semi inexpensive then this is your place. The carpet in our room looked dirty and old. There were stains in the carpet and the room just felt dirty. But during our stay we didn’t have any major issues. It was quite and the walk to downtown Disney was about 15min. Overall I don’t think we’ll be staying here again.

We had a one night stay as part of a package with Disneyland tickets. This hotel is just across the street from the Disney parking, so very convenient if you are driving to Disneyland. We were able to check in quite early, which was nice of the manager to do since my husband couldn't go to Disneyland with me and needed somewhere to hang out. We had 2 service dogs with us and there isn't much space for them to "do their business" but we made do. The room was a good size, 2 queen beds Everything was worn and could really use some updating. The room smelled like it had once been a smoking room - my PJs even smelled a little smokey the next day after sleeping in the bed. TV was small but worked, we had to ask for a list of the channels from the front desk. Towels were very thin.

Summary Heading: Cheaper (ish) - get what you pay for
Summary: It’s a 10-15 minute walk to Downtown Disney, so a great location, but a below average hotel.   The price of the room was one of the cheaper rates we found for the location, so we went with this based on the fact we’d spend most of our time at Disney. We didn’t spend anymore time there than we had to.  The room was clean although had a bit of an old smell to it. Unfortunately it’s right next to some traffic lights and the freeway, so generally pretty loud in the room.   We had free breakfast as part of it, this was a choice of two cereals, porridge sachets, and pre-packaged muffins.  It has free parking which is a perk though, and since you could walk to Disney, we did save $20 a day.  In hindsight, we should have paid an extra $20 a night for a better hotel.

Summary Heading: We could see the Disneyland  fireworks perfectly from the...
Summary: We could see the Disneyland  fireworks perfectly from the hotel room. Hotel was clean,  beds were comfortable. It was pretty basic without many amenities, but worked for us.  The closeness to Disneyland made it easy to get up and get in the park early the next morning

Summary Heading: close to main street/highway very noise
Summary: Even though it seem close to Disney land, it's still far for walking, especially with little kids.

I was very hesitant of staying in this hotel after reading all the bad reviews, but we had a budget for our Disneyland trip and this was priced very well.We just needed a place to sleep since we would spend all day at Disney and this was a good place, it’s a very simple room but very clean it included a fridge and microwave which was a plus because we brought our own microwaveable food. It’s exactly 30 min walk to the entrance of Downtown Disney  not bad in the morning but very tiring trying to come back at night. Did not interact with staff only for check in and seemed friendly. No stores or food places around only a gas station across the street.
my 4 year old was bit on the cheek by a bed bug. and i watched and caught a bed bug crawling right next to my 2 year old. was left on the counter in a cup for them to see

Summary Heading: Clean, but need to to be updated
Summary: The hotel is clean, but everything ins disgustingly old.  The Wifi is HORRIBLE, almost nonexistent.

Summary Heading: Bring your own pillows and towels
Summary: My stay was not great. I thank the past reviews about the towels being like sand paper and so I brought my own. I also brought my own pillows and blankets just to be comfortable. I also wished I had checked under the bed as soon as I checked in for there were things under the bed that were not mine including a receipt from 2 weeks ago, a empty cookie tray, a sock, hair clips, and a straw. Toilet also needed to be worked on for the flapper did not close right.

There was no breakfast, just prepackaged muffins. We had to buy breakfast every day which is what we were trying to avoid. The driveway is hard to get in and out of due to where it’s located, internet barely works...housekeeping is great and keeps the room very nice. Front desk staff nice. Basically a place to sleep while you’re at Disney all day. Quick walk to Disney. But wish I would’ve known about the breakfast.

The room was decent. All the towels were rough like sandpaper and very thin. Most of the air conditioning units that we walked by had ice buckets under them and the towels under the ones in the stairwells. We have been in better Days Inn with softer towels and better building appearance and rooms. This one definitely disappointed us.

Very convenient  for Disney,  the hotel is in dire need of makeover,the towels were just bigger than a hand towels and we'll worn out,says breakfast included  but if a bowl of bran or frosties with a muffin is your idea of breakfast that's what you get ,the staff pleasant would  not stay here again

Dirty , awful, depressing..  It was so gross and so bad that we left and paid for another hotel that night.  Yuk!  I’ve stayed some bad places.  But this was gross and wayyyy worse than we expected.   I don’t suggest staying here when excited for a nice Disney vacation.  I actually felt unsafe, the old wooden doors looked liked someone could kick in no problem.

The bathroom had mold around the shower walls, the towels you can see daylight through them and they were so rough felt like drying off with 80 grit sandpaper. The door when locked still had daylight all the way around it, didn’t give me any warm fuzzies about the security. The free breakfast, let’s put it this way, I sure wouldn’t have paid for it. Very disappointing being that close to Disneyland. The pool was filthy.

While the location to Disneyland was excellent, the motel itself was very run down.  The parking was tight and nearly impossible to squeeze into.  The rooms were clean, but the walls were peeling and there were no electrical outlets available.  The electrical outlet behind the TV had 5 things connected and we were afraid of a fire hazard.  The Continental Breakfast was lame.  Not impressed. No internet connection.

Summary Heading: I understand Continental breakfast but that wasn't a...
Summary: I understand Continental breakfast but that wasn't a Continental breakfast I've ever had. Muffins, cereal and coffee, really! How about some juice, bagels, waffle and not having to ask for milk or juice because you keep it in the back.

Summary Heading: I would recommend this place it’s a nice place to stay its...
Summary: I would recommend this place it’s a nice place to stay its within walking distance of Disneyland and California adventure restaurants and shops if you are looking for a great value and good sleep this is the place i would stay again

Customer service was rude on the phone. I was charged the day of check in. Parking was impossibly full and no shuttle service information was provided. My room was infested with ants and not corrected. I was woken up by the the sound of the shower in the room next to me. Sounded like squealing. The breakfast was a box of cereal and milk that tasted off. Front desk service was rude and spoke little english. This was not worth the money spent.

Summary Heading: Was about a 15 min walk to downtown Disney we could also...
Summary: Was about a 15 min walk to downtown Disney we could also see fireworks from the room. Great price the parking wasn't all that great but definitely going to pay for a room here next year.

Stayed here only for the convenience of an easy walk to Disneyland just a 10 min or so walk. The hotel it's self is dated furniture could use some major improvement they were old and worn. the walls looked to have been recently as well as the bathroom looked to have been remodel in room 306. However I'm only 5'10 and the shower head was so low and only came to below my chest had to duck down to shower. The linens need a huge improvement towels were thin and rough!, the pillows were flat and lumpy and one of the comforters had a visible tear in it. The breakfast was simple coffee/tea some dry prepackaged muffins oatmeal and cereal with milk that you had to ask for at the front desk. There was no siting area in the dining room so you either had to go back to your room and eat or

I'm surprised that the Day's Inn folks allow this property to be a part of their franchise. My company booked this site through the travel portal. The site's rating has been definitely inflated. Not a business friendly place.  My room was clean, but there were ants in sink area.  The internet service was sporadic and often slow.  The weather strip on the was so worn that daylight and potentially bugs could get in. The door jam was very loose potentially making the lock ineffective.  The traffic noise from the Disney entrance was very load, especially in the morning.  The Breakfast was extremely limits, options of cereal, packaged muffins, and weak coffee.  This place could be a cheap stay for the nearby parks, but I'd recommend spending a few more dollars for a safer, cleaner,
I enjoyed my stay at Days Inn. The rooms were very clean and had lots of space. The hotel was very quiet and only a 15 minute walk from Disneyland. It was perfect for our trip!
Close to disneyland,  not super clean and yes we had ants in our room too! Just an inexpensive hotel close to the parks but you get what you pay for.

Summary Heading: close to the parks but needs to be renovated
Summary: Location was close to the parks. The room looked clean but is in need of a major need or a renovation. Most of the furniture was beat up, the varnish on the tabletop was missing in spots & the door to the cabinet covering the refrigerator  didn't close correctly . The bathroom had several broken tiles on the floor and a lot of visible water damage to the base of the  walls, rather then fix it they just painted over it .

Summary Heading: Dirty, Wrong Side of Disney, Fireworks would be a problem for small children
Summary: Place was a little dark/dirty, Fireworks from Disney sounded as if they were being launched from the parking lot, wrong side of Disney for walking, overall it was worth the money, but not relaxing.

They have locked down the parking structure so guest at hotel can no longer catch tram. The walk is far to the park. Disney wants everyone to pay for parking. I will be looking c for another hotel closet to park. This hotel should offer transportation to park to keep guest happy

The service was good, and the room was clean and well stocked, but the continental breakfast was a massive letdown. There was nothing but a shelf of small muffins and individually packaged dry cereal, but there wasn't even milk for your cereal. On our second morning the muffin I bit into was moldy. Also don't be tricked by the map into thinking that this is within walking distance of  Disneyland, since it's actually located on the backside of the park and requires quite a lot of walking unless you're willing to pay for a parking pass.

Bad towels bad sheets beds pillows. Carpet extremely dirty. Ants in bathroom and all over maids cart. Bad breakfast misleading when I reserved room only 2 left b/s. There was never more than 8 cars in parking lot at any time. Would not let me use Wyndham rewards discount or apply this stay to my rewards account. Stay away

stayed here about a year ago the first room we were offered had fleas jumping on our 11 year old daughter the manager is just a down right rude and does not care if you stay or not used the hot tub and it was luke warm reported it to the desk but it never was adressed or fixed , the free breakfast was coffee or tea a small muffin and cereral they do have small boxs of milk that they keep behind the front desk and hand out one at a time they dont set them out and wont give you one unless you ask them for it . i think what they dont hand out they take home ... now the best way to get to the Disneyland is to walk to the sidewalk turn left and walk a short ways to the driveway that gos to the back of the  Disney parking garage you will have to take the stairs to the 2nd floor then

This days inn is terrible never coming here with my family again !! The rooms are gross the bathrooms are terrible the appliances don't even work they are not honest with there prices and there service sucks ! I would rather stay at motel 6 where there atleast honest with there price and the rooms are nicer and cleaner !! This days inn is so ugly they need to shut it down !
The locks on rooms were broke and we had to have someone unlock our room each time we returned. There were also ants all Over the room

The bathroom and sink were crawling with ants throughout our stay.  Additionally, when I dropped my room keycard by the bed and bent over to pick it up, I found several old room keycards under the bed (and some large dust bunnies).  The bedside lamp, and the floor lamp were not plugged in when we arrived, and I had to find outlets for them so they could be used.  While I was in the lobby eating the complimentary breakfast (which included cereal but no milk), another group of guests brought in the large bug they captured in their bathroom.  At least it wasn't very expensive.
A very good location but not very clean. Ants were everywhere in the bathroom which made us kind of grossed out. Then at the stairway there were really dirty sheets just laying there.

Summary Heading: Horrible place. I will never stay here again.
Summary: This hotel was horrible. Dirty, noisy, and the staff was very rude and unhelpful. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, and I will never stay here again.

Summary Heading: VERY DIRTY AND OLD DIRTY CARPETS AND NASTY RESTROOMS THE...
Summary: VERY DIRTY AND OLD DIRTY CARPETS the property was nasty and bathrooms small and nasty it hasn't been kept up never staying there again in fact was looking for a different place to stay shame on wyndham for allowing it to be part of your establishment

My daughter lives in L a and is at present working at Disney so I chose this Motel on Price, Parking and proximity to Disneyworld. The room was clean and contained facilities to cook with but no utensils!!! The air conditioning was excellent and the wi fi worked well The staff were lovely and very helpful. My only problem was that the bed was horrendous!!! You could feel all the springs. A memory foam topper would have solved the problem so the owner needs to spend some money because this was the worst nights sleep that I had during my stay in LA x
Parking can be a challenge but the desk guys helped out. Rooms show their age but ours was cleans and you can't get closer to the park.
Not a great hotel. Felt unclean. Problems with air conditioning. Customer service from front desk to solve the air conditioning was great.

Although the hotel was old and we thought the pool needed refreshing, the staff were polite and extremely helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We were pleased to have three queen sized beds, after finding most hotels will only accommodate families of four. The walk to Disneyland Resort was longer than anticipated--17-20 minutes to the Mickey and Friends parking structure tram, so a hotel shuttle would have been nice. I do believe the hotel needs to invest in nicer towels. Overall, our stay was pleasant and worth the money we spent on it.

Summary Heading: They don't have a good selection for breakfast. The rooms...
Summary: They don't have a good selection for breakfast. The rooms are old and most of the lights didn't work in the room. When we came back from Disneyland one day the maid forgot to close our room door and all of our things were exposed for anyone to take. They keep the little cartons of milk locked up and if you want one for the cereal they only give you one when you have four kids and one of the mangers constantly blocks people's cars in because he lives on the premises.

Hotel needs a remodel carpet is very old and dirty and smells like mildew... one of the a/c units in the second bed room was leaking water into the room left carpet all wet evil never ever stay at this hotel again....

the only reason i book this hotel was the location / but i was wrong  i took me 30 min fast walking  to disneyland  and about 50 min if i took the tram btw there is no walking access true walnut st aka parking lot

This is one of the few reasonably priced hotels/motels in the immediate area. Rooms are a little dated and worn but it was kept clean and if all you are doing is sleeping than the parks all day than this might be the place for you.

This is a classic example of 'you pay for what you get'. The staff are very friendly and helpful, The rooms are dated with a few flaws but if you want a place to crash after a day at the parks than this will suit your needs. The internet is good for messaging and posting pics on facebook but not so sure you would want to stream a movie with it. The walk is decent but keep in mind any previous telling you to cut thru the back parking lot is outdated as they have stopped non employees from doing that so you have to walk down Disneyland Drive then across to the entrance to the parking lot than over to the trams. Bed is comfortable. Breakfast is sparse but a little something like cereal fills the belly till you hit the parks.

Perfect location! Wanted to stay close to Disneyland since we were meeting family. It was about 20 min walk so it was great. Nice to have a little breakfast that they offered for free. Would have been nice to have a little fruit with the breakfast. Clean room. Friendly staff! Hope to go back and stay here again. Great value,

I had a room on the ground floor for 3 nights. Room was very spacious & clean (then again I didn't go looking for problems with the room, for me it is best not to) and there were always plenty of towels. My only issue was the room was very dark, even with the lights on. The room didn't smell mouldy, just old, would've liked to have been able to open the window but this was bolted shut (guessing this is for security purposes) however a window bolt could be used & that would allow for some fresh air.

This place is a dump and not worth the $128 I paid to stay there. It is very difficult to get to at night. I had to drive around it 3 times before I finally found the driveway. The carpet looked as if it had never been cleaned. The towels are very thin and rough. The free breakfast is skimpy and closes at 9am. There is no shuttle to Disneyland. The staff say it is a 5 min walk, which is a lie. It took almost half an hour to walk there. I'll never stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very good service but did have to leave
Summary: This motel is on a very noisy corner fairly close to Disneyland.  It offers very modest accommodations which for personal reasons did not work for us.  It appeared to be very clean.  I was most impressed with the staff member on duty, James, who was a good representative in every way for the motel and chain - flexible and helpful.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The lobby smelled like mold....otherwise the room was just okay.  You get what you pay for.  If you want something cheap and dont plan on spending much time in the room, this could be a good fit for you

The room was dirty. Bath tub wouldn't drain properly. Breakfast was a joke. I wouldn't stay here again. It is over a mile walk to Disneyland, too far for kids. I felt like I was staying in the ghetto.

If you want to walk to Disneyland and get a good value, this is the place to stay.  Nice easy 25-30 minute walk. Breakfast was pretty skimpy, but something in the stomach to get you through until you road a few ride was ok.

This hotel has all the basics (bf, refrig, micro, jacuzzi) within walking distance to the tram.  Returning at night, it is easier to walk thru Downtown Disney straight to the hotel.  During the day, it is easy to return for naps, and go back for evening activities when the crowds are smaller.  Great price!

Summary Heading: I would definitely stay here again!
Summary: Perfect for a fun family trip to Disneyland, when you can't afford the high end.. It's comfortable and safe, and the staff was very friendly..

Summary Heading: Clean and right next to Disney
Summary: It was clean, loud at night though with all of the cars. You can see the fireworks from the hotel. Disney is a 10 minute walk away!
Our stay in anihiem was great. Staff was great, location was good. Could see fireworks from the balcony. Will use this hotel again

This was the perfect place for us. We had 4 teenage girls with us, and this was perfect. We had three beds, and plenty of room for stuff...Parking was a nightmare, and getting into the parking lot was very difficult.  The  front office staff was great, check in was easy, and the room was clean. I will defiantly be back.
Room was clean and neat, not near enough outlets for today's gadgets. Especially if you're traveling with kids or family etc with multiple devices.

First off, be aware that when booking online, the room did not specify whether it was smoking or non-smoking, and we were therefore booked into a smoking room which smelled horrid. We were changed to a new room the following night when it was made available, which we greatly appreciated. Otherwise, you get what you're paying for in this hotel - the breakfast is nonexistent (no juice or real food), and there are no frills whatsoever. However, the location of the driveway makes it difficult to get to, and if you ever need an Uber/Lyft/cab, you can count on them passing the hotel before finally finding it. If you're not planning to walk to the park (about 30 minutes) or drive, I wouldn't recommend this location. The one on South Harbour is easier to find and much more comfortable.

it was a terrible stay, first of all there was bugs in the bathroom tub, then there breakfast they say is full breakfast is only tiny muffins and tiny bowl of cereal and then last you are not gauranteed a parking space if you get back to your room late at night

A one night stay to go to Disney. It wouldn't be so bad, but if the Free wi-fi-, cable, and breakfast was up to par it wouldn't be a one star.  He had to keep reloading wi-fi so we couldn't be on much, TV channels was static, and breakfast, had no juice, milk but muffins and oatmeal.  Towels were very rough and scratchy and wasn't real comfortable. Service was casual and oh well we will only give you two or we don't have it or just not really caring.
The location was good however they didn't give us input on walking to the park and the best route until we checked out.
Missing coffee maker in room. Breakfast served until 9 AM, 9:01 gone. No breakfast, no sign. Tight parking. Large vehicles not recommended. Full size truck max.

Summary Heading: Good and convenient stay close to the Disneyland Park
Summary: I've stayed in this hotel a couple of times when visiting the Disneyland park. The hotel is close to the park, with roughly 20 min walking distance. After the new parking structure is built, the walking path is a bit further than in the past. You have to go through the Downtown Disney stores to get to the park. The room is clean and spacious, and has convenient appliances (fridge, microwave) I need for a family leisure trip with kids. The property also has washer and dryer onsite. The free breakfast is very basic, with just muffins, cereals/instant oat meals. Internet is slow during peak time at night, and ok during the day. That is the least of our concern when we have a packed and exhausting day visiting the park. Will definitely go back again!

The location was great for the price. We got to see the fireworks from Disneyland one night. That was maybe the best of it. We didn't get to the pool because we were at the parks all the time. But it just didn't have the hotel cleanliness we expected. It had a bad odor our first night. The room was fairly small so the table was right in front of the AC. There was a towel under an AC vent in the stairway and when it wasn't there, there was a puddle of water. Ice buckets were under a lot, if not all, of the rest by the rooms.
The beds were very uncomfortable. poor mattresses. very dirty sticky carpets and vanity tile area. very limited breakfast menu. slim selection.  We will not be staying here ever again.

I mean it's pretty much what you'd expect for the price in comparison to other hotels in the area.   It's much older and it shows. You're getting the bare essentials here, but it's not really a bad thing. We stayed for two nights for a Disneyland trip and it's did just fine as a place to sleep.   But it is SUPER close to Disneyland. We would get up in the morning and grab muffins that are in lobby on our way to Disneyland.   The walk to the parking lot tram that takes you to Disneyland was maybe 10 minutes. Just get there early, and you'll be there before the morning parking lot crowds.   From when we left to when we arrived at Disneyland, maybe twenty minutes total and skipped the parking line, parking fees, tram fees, etc.

After traveling for a month we came here... we were asking for our money back for the 3 nights we paid for 15 minutes after paying for the nights. Disgusting, I can't believe Wyndham are putting their name of this... we were given a smokers room, smelt so bad and were told we need to pay an extra $40 a night for a 2 single bed, non smoking room. No way was I going to pay more money to this place. It needs urgent updating, the bed sunk down through the middle and had this old comforter sprawled over the top that looks like it was the 'in' thing in 1960. The staff were ok, I felt bad that I had to say such horrible things about a place but it was just such a shock that places like this are allowed to even operate. We were denied a refund for that night which is disappointing to

Summary Heading: Excellent Budget Hotel in Perfect Location
Summary: For the price, this hotel was excellent. It's very close to the Disneyland park (about a 15-20 minute walk to the trams) and easy to get to and from the freeway. It has all the amenities you would expect. Beds are reasonably comfortable and the nights were quiet.  You might have some difficulty with the parking lot if you're driving a bigger car (there are not enough spaces for as many rooms as they have, so you must double park at night) and I would bring my own towels next time, because even though they provided them, they were very small and thin.

First and foremost, the staff was very nice and helpful.  The rooms? Not so much. I understand that not every property is going to have the newest and nicest things, but every property should be thoroughly cleaned (it looked like areas hadn't been dusted in months, ring around bathtub, build-up in shower head, dirty walls) and have towels that aren't sand paper. These are basic, affordable investments.

Summary Heading: I can't believe Wyndham would put thier name on this property.
Summary: This place is even worse than what it looks like online. Dirty dirty down right gross place. Once we arrived the room was digusting the second room was the same I immediately requested a refund. I just couldn't keep my family there.  134.00/nt. Waste of money.

basically the parking is very reduced, the inside of the shower curtain was disgusting it seem like it never gets cleaned, towels were so rough, unable to adjust temperature on the small refrigerator, it was not cold enough, the air conditioner is loud making it difficult to fully rest, we went to get ice but we didn't use it because there was a bug in one of the ice cubes.  I'm not booking on this Days Inn ever again.

Very close to Disneyland. Check-in was done in under a few minutes. Hotel is showing signs of age, but overall clean. Double check your bill, I was charged for phone use, yet no one used the phone. I was also charged $28 more that what my windham rewards reservation rate was, so check what they are charging you in detail.
This was a short family vacation to the Disneyland park. The hotel is conviently located and reasonably priced. It is quiet and comfortable.

Great location, but the hotel really needs to be updated. Our room looked like it was last updated in the 1980s. The beds needed to be replaced and the towels were horrible. The fixtures and lampshades in the room were not very clean/had a lot of wear.   The staff was very friendly and the location great, but we won't stay here again. With updates to the rooms, this could be a great place.
We stayed in room 214- it was Great! We where able to sleep, we had hot water, our Suv was safe. We will be coming back in May! Thank you for a Great stay.

Hotel is very close to Disney, but also right next to the highway.  If you are a light sleeper, road noise will be an issue.  Also, breakfast was very limited (offered cereal but had to ask for milk to be brought from the back).

I've stayed in Days Inn Hotels many times over the years.  They've always been clean and comfortable not to mention affordable.  The location was perfect.  We could walk or take the tram to and from Disneyland.  The only negative point, breakfast didn't have much to offer and it was the exact same each morning.

The hotel was close enough to the Disneyland park we were able to walk for maybe 15-20 minutes and be there. The room itself was comfortable and very spacious. Only real complaint I had about the room was the lack of outlets. They have outlets but across the room from most places you could be nearby to whatever item it was you were charging.  But the staff was great and beds were very comfortable. And after a day walking around Disneyland that was greatly appreciated.
There was hair in the bathtube and I had to wipe it down before I took my baby a bath and the room smelled moldy .

Pool was dirty, hot tub was not working. Rooms were large and roomy but furniture was old and falling apart. Bathroom tiles in shower were literally falling off. We were specifically looking for a place with a hot tub to relax too at the end of the day and were very disappointed that it was out of order. Continental breakfast was lame. I know it's not suppossed to be fancy but they didn't even have fresh fruit available. It was cheap and very convenient walk to the free shuttle to Disney Land.

Summary Heading: Great location and price but needs improvements
Summary: Close to Disney Land parking lot and decent price but they need to clean the carpets every once and a while, spray for ants, get new towels because they feel like sandpaper. I'm sure they make plenty of money thanks to Disney Land so they can afford to give customers a clean room.

Summary Heading: The biggest thing is it's an old building, mattresses don't...
Summary: The biggest thing is it's an old building, mattresses don't allow for a very comfortable sleep, and continental breakfast isn't much. Maid service would come regularly and staff and friendly and helpful but there is a reason you get the price you get.

We have stayed at a half dozen 'budget friendly' motels over the years, this one was by far the worst.  Mold in the bath tub, broken fixtures & floor tiles, dirty carpet, laughable continental breakfast.  Except for the proximity to the resort this place was a total bust.  I will be staying elsewhere next time.

The room was decent only main issue was (hopefully just our room) the vent in the bathroom didn't work so it got stuffy after showering and the water was either freezing or burning.  The wifi was super slow and aggravating. Also their breakfast wasn't really breakfast at all, however for the price I paid. I didn't mind it. I would definitely try it out again.
Very close to the parks. I felt safe. Clean. But only one car allowed so I got 2 beds which is an extra cost and she had to drive home that night, that was a big damper on our weekend.
I like it here because its only a few mins from Disneyland. It only takes about 10 mins on walking so great. What i didn't like is the beds are very uncomfortable  people there are all not very nice.
It was a bit overpriced for what it was. The hotel was a bit dated but the service was nice and the location was great.

No shuttle service so we elected to drive and park at Disneyland Parking Garage, (ITS LITERALLY AROUND THE CORNER BUT YOU CANNOT WALK TO IT).  It was worth paying the $18.00.   You can walk down the block and take public transit,  but if you have a group, the cost of public transit might be the same as the parking fee.   Rooms clean enough, breakfast is NOT breakfast, it is cereal (no milk though hahaha!!) and some packaged muffins.  There are refrigerators in the rooms, so bought our own stuff for breakfast.  We bring our own pillows and blankets so sleeping was fine. There is an elevator that works.  So overall, this worked for us.

The room was clean, modern and good size, the beds were comfortable. The carpet however was filthy - it is a dark colour to hide the dirt and our feet were black after walking on it. Rubbish bins outside the rooms weren't emptied very often. Be aware that as it is close to Disneyland families and kids will get up relatively early and make noise outside the rooms. The heated pool and spar is a bonus. The breakfast is very basic, but good that it is included. Staff were friendly and there was ample parking.

Summary Heading: The picture of the motel is misleading because it is a side...
Summary: The picture of the motel is misleading because it is a side view.  The actual frontage on the street is the narrow end of the motel.  The front office is very small and that's where you get a simple breakfast--cold cereal and muffin.  There is no seating there.  The parking lot is small and difficult to get in and out of.  The room is adequate and clean, nothing special.  It is a short walk to the Disneyland tram.

The outside of the hotel was not the nicest but for the price, you get what you pay for. Short walk to the Disneyland Resort. Rooms were clean. Clean sheets and pillows. No weird stains located anywhere in the room. Rooms can be a bit noisy due to it being so close to the freeway but sleep quality was decent for me. Pool and spa were pretty small. Good room for the price. If you're looking for a five star hotel then this is not the place for you. If you're looking for somewhere to stay for a night or two for a decent price and clean rooms, this is a good place to stay.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you like fireworks
Summary: The hotel was grungy, and old. In great need of a facelift. The breakfast was skimpy. There were no plugs available in the room. The wifi did not work. But every night at 9:30 if you go outside your front door you get a very close up and very very loud fireworks show.

Summary Heading: Good service, good room, good rest
Summary: We had a great vacation, and the room helped by being close to Disneyland, clean every time we came back, and we rested very well at night. The only thing wrong was we could hear other people shower and walk around, and it was kind of loud but other than that we had no issues

Stayed here from December 31, 2016 - January 2, 2017 and it was a great stay! We arrived exactly at check-in time (3:00 PM), and our room was ready, clean, and comfortable. Prior to arriving, we made sure to research all of the high's and low's of staying here, but honestly, our stay was great in all aspects!  Some of the highlights that made our trip were: - Very good insulation (it was freezing when we visited). - House-keeping is excellent, they replaced all used towels, changed the garbage, and did light tidying up. - Front-desk service is phenomenal (they let us park our car in the lot for free after checking out because they weren't busy with visitors, and they let us check-out early). - Light continental breakfast (coffee is all I need!). - It is very quiet at all times.

Summary Heading: Not Worthy of Days Inn Brand
Summary: This hotel is at a great location and has the family room which has 3 queen beds which is great for bigger families. But that is it. There is no other good things about this place. The breakfast is the worst breakfast I have ever had in nay hotel in my life and I travel a lot. The rooms and carpets are dirty. I was there for only one night to sleep but otherwise I would be ashamed to take my family to this hotel.
Not worth the money very unclean out of date rooms .... Staff is nice and helpful but overall not worth it

Summary Heading: Nice stay but the parking situation is very tight
Summary: Stayed in the 3 queen room on the top floor.  It was close to the elevator so access was great. Did not have to lug bags up stairs. Room was typical for an Inn/motel but nice and clean. Breakfast was limited on choices but I'm always grateful to have a little something start the day. The queen beds were a little on the hard side for me; I prefer a softer bed but that's just me. Three things to be mindful of  are: 1) The limited parking spaces. 2) The private bedroom in our "suite" did not have a heater.  It does have an air conditioning unit which would be great in the summer, but it was a cold in December and there was no heat in that room.  We left the door open to access the heat from the main room and it was bearable. 3) Limited access to outlets for chargers.  We had to get

How would like to come back to your room tired after being at Disneyland for your child's 4th bday all day and night and get in bed and ants crawling all over your kids, the walls, pillows, phone, desk top, lamp. My kids were freaking out and for our troubles we had to pack up all of our stuff and move our 4yr & 2yr old in the dead of night freezing outside to a smaller room, with moldy bathroom walls. When I complained they told me sorry we'all do better next time. Like really? Sorry won't be a next time!!' I never complain unless it's serious but this was unacceptable. Also the carpet in the rooms are  so dirty they turn your feet black!!! Never again!!!

Summary Heading: Easily the worst part of my trip
Summary: First let me say that I'm not picky about motel rooms. Safe and clean, those are my only two requirements. This failed both. First of all, it's very difficult to get into, the driveway is small and poorly marked. Second, the room was dirty.  There was garbage behind the furniture, under the bed, and the edges of the carpet next to the walls were piled with dust. The air conditioner was black with stains. Speaking of the a/c, it didn't work. The shower curtain was falling off the wall which made the bathroom soaked when you showered because you couldn't close the curtain.  The furniture was beat to hell and the room looked nothing at all like the pictures. We were in a non smoking room reeked of stale cigarettes. Disneyland launches their fireworks next door so starting at 9:30

Location good close to Disneyland. Parking not enough spots for guest and I had to park in the drive because other spots were double parked (Parked by the office staff). I Had to move my truck so others could get out. Rooms dirty and dated, floors squeaked, and a cabinet bounced while walking across the floor. I slipped and fell out of the shower/tub while taking a shower, and there was no slip resistant material in the bottom of the tub and the tub was not level. When we brought all of our issues up to the office staff they said you can get with Days Inn online to make a complaint. No other information given to us.  If you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay here, but you will be sorry, as their is no value here.  We were told by the office staff " Its Days Inn

Summary Heading: The service was horrible and they charged me twice .( their...
Summary: The service was horrible and they charged me twice .( their mistake) no breakfast and very dirty room the view outside was horrible

Carpet was dirty. Wouldn't let my kids on floor. Convenient to disneyland. Terrible parking setup. Not enough spaces. A lot of double parked cars. Breakfast opened at 7 and didn't have the hot breakfast that days inn promotes. Staff for was nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: My stay at the Days Inn next to Disneyland
Summary: I loved the location but the place is need of some serious improvements. The room felt dirty, the furniture was very old and abused, my light did not work even after having maintenance replace the bulb, the shower is a death trap and I fell out of it, but the biggest problem is its very low lit in the parking lot and they have no security. When I went to leave at 5:00pm to meet my wife at a restaurant down the street there was a man at the light right outside the hotel trying desperately to pick a fight with me. Like I said, location is great and the staff are friendly but NOT a safe place to be.

This room was cheap and that was why we booked it. We had 3 days at Disneyland and a day at Knottsberry Farm planned so we weren't planning on spending much time in the room anyway. The hairdryer in our room was broken and the wifi cuts in and out but other than that the rooms were clean and comfortable.
The towels are a little scratchy and there is nothing fancy about the room but for the price and location you cannot beat it.

The only thing going for this place is its proximity to Disneyland. Beyond that there is absolutely no reason to stay here. The parking lot is too small for the number of units and the spaces themselves are too close together for your average SUV. The units need updating and were dingy. The deadbolt on the door didn't lock at all. Both my husband and I slept poorly and woke up with back pain. The continental "breakfast" consisted solely of packaged muffins, instant oatmeal packets, and dry cereal--no milk. We didn't get to try out the pool but based on the looks of the rest of this place, I'm sure I didn't miss anything. Luckily we were only here for one night--9 hours to be exact. If you plan to stay longer than this, I recommend finding somewhere else!

Our room was a good value for the lower fees in comparison to others close to Disneyland.  Just walk to the Mickey and Friends parking garage, through Level 2, and there is the tram.  If you choose to walk down Disney Way you will arrive about half way through downtown Disney by following the signs..about 20 minutes.  Room was clean, a/c was relatively quiet, everything worked fine, and the bed was comfortable.  Liked the fact there was a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and hair dryer.  The fireworks are close so you can just stand outside your door and watch them with a nice clear view.  The pool looked like no one used it and there were quite a few leaves floating on it.   There were no jets or swirling in the hot tub and I stuck my foot in the water and it wasn't very hot at

Summary Heading: Stay was fine, but could have improvement
Summary: The stay overall was fine, but the faucet in our room was pretty much broken. Both knobs were on full blast on the sink, but only a small stream of water would come out. We searched around the room for outlets to charge our phones, but could only find one which I had to unplug the lamp and alarm clock from it to be able to use it. Other than those problems, the stay was just fine and the representatives at the front desk were great :) Thank you!

We have stayed here and choose it for its location and the walk to the shuttle.  It is clean and comfortable.  Lots of street noise but not bad.   Dave at the day manager was a great representative of your company.   So helpful and gracious.

I found my stay at the Days Inn Anaheim West quite pleasant. The motel was conveniently located to Disneyland being a little over 1/2 mile to Downtown Disney. And, although located at a major interchange, the rooms were very quiet--except for the half hour or so that Disney had their fireworks display! That event is staged just across the street so the motel's second floor balcony provided the ideal spot to enjoy the show.  While the weather was cool enough to pass on the use of the swimming pool, I did avail myself of the hot tub to ease my tired knees after a couple of days at The Park. Both were quite clean and refreshing.

Summary Heading: I don't know why everyone complains so much, it's not the Ritz
Summary: We arrived late for check in, but had called ahead knowing we were running late.  The parking was fine, if people understand the concept of staying between the lines.  (yes I'm talking to those with California licence plates).  The Front desk person was very pleasant, and soon we were in our room.   To be clear, I knew when I booked this hotel that it was very in-expensive, so I went into it knowing not to expect turn down service in a four poster bed with a chocolate on my pillow.  The A/C worked, the lights all worked, the beds were comfortable.  There were more than enough blankets and pillows.  There was ample drawers for clothes, and room to hang things.  The carpets seemed to be in need of a good cleaning, but they had been vaccumed, and although the bathroom was old, the

Went to Disneyland. Great location to park your car, and walk to the park 2 blocks away. Room was very clean and staff very accommodating. Enjoyed our stay. Tucked away in the trees, so we drove by the hotel twice before finding it.

Summary Heading: Wish I could give it a 0
Summary: This hotel was terrible.  Our room smelled like urine.  We couldn't wait to get out of there.  I wouldn't even use the shower.  I didn't even want to walk on the carpet.  There wasn't even any water at the "continental breakfast" which consisted of coffee and cheap muffins.  So disappointed.  The amount I paid for this hotel was ridiculous for how gross it was. SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN!

Summary Heading: close to Disney, not worth 160 per night
Summary: room should be allot cheaper due to old muggy rooms. Only benefit is right next to Disney parking lot

This is a value hotel close to Disneyland.  Our room was very spacious, with enough room to get a scooter in and out.  Constantly finding little ANTS in the bathroom or on the sink!!!!  Loved that the laundry room was open all hours of the day.  Which made it very nice to do laundry after spending a day in the parks.  Also accommodated our early arrival, which was AWESOME.    There is an ART bus that stops close to the hotel that will take you right to Disneyland.  Or it's a short walk to Downtown Disney and the parks...

The room we got had 3 queen beds so a huge room. But, in desperate need of updates. Walls filthy, very old paint, all the a/c units outside had ice buckets under them due to leakage, and ours had to be turned on and off per the office to keep it running. Very unsavory people around. Even a lady smoking a pipe that we had to walk our granddaughter by to get to our room. Parking? Horrendous! Will never stay there again. Room looks more like it should be rented by the hour.
I was surprised at how run down this hotel was.  It wasn't very clean and we hope they make improvements soon.  It gave the Days Inn hotel chain a bad name.

We had a room full of teens and booked one of the 3Queen rooms. It actually had one bed in a separate room, which was great news for the adults! Location is great for either a walk or a drive to the trams that serve Disneyland/Downtown Disney. Breakfast is as cheap as possible, so don't expect to be full, but if a muffin or coffee is enough, then you're good to go. The pool and hot tub were okay. I've seen both better and worse. The only real negative is that at the end of our stay we noticed something that appears like someone tried breaking into our car. There's weird marks on the back door. There wasn't anything valuable in the car, so I don't know if they gave up or were scared off, but I definitely wouldn't leave anything of value there! Since we'd walked to Disneyland each

I'm a single mom and my daughter turned 18 and wanted to go to Disneyland with her friends for her birthday with why dam rewards I was able to book these 2 rooms at this days in at a affordable price. When we got there with 10 people they were so nice one room had 3 queens and the other had 3 queens and a pullout.the staff was so a assuring and welcoming we walked to Disneyland saved money on parking!this single mom and 9 crazy teens felt so good and had a great stay I can't thank the days Inn enough my daughter has a memory of a lifetime great place in my book!

Summary Heading: I wish there was a lower rating than one
Summary: Let's start with the good stuff. It's very close to Disneyland, it has a free shuttle, and it was very affordable. Now for the rest of it. We walked in and the rooms look like something out of a horror movie. They were old and stinky and melled like cigarette smoke. The deadbolt didn't work. The towels actually hurt us when we were using them to dry off they were so rough. I was afraid to walk on the carpet barefoot because I was sure I was going to catch some sort of fungus.  The continental breakfast was as skimpy as it could've possibly been. And they had absolutely no other rooms and it was very late at night so we just made the best of it and bolted in the morning. I will never stay there again.

Good value for price. Staff was very nice and helpful. Nice easy walk to Disneyland, or walk to the Micky and Friends for a tram ride, or less than 1/2 block walk to the Anaheim Resort Transit bus.  Of the Harbor Blvd, Katella, and Ball Rd hotels near Disneyland, this has the best value for the dollar.  Be forewarned. The fireworks are INCREDIBLY loud.  Its part of the Magic!!!

Was older but clean. Walking distance to disneyland trams was not very far. Does require stairs into mickey and friends parking structure. Limited parking. Friendly service. Breakfast very limited. Overall it was worth the price. Will stay again.

Summary Heading: Old Property in Need of Updating
Summary: There is little to commend this property other than its location to Disneyland. All I needed was a bed for a few hours sleep. I got that much. While I accepted the downside, my wife would never have stayed there. Room towels were like sandpaper.

I am a touring musician on the road over 160 hotel nights a year. This hotel is pretty close to the bottom of the barrel.  It's in desperate need of upgrades and refurbishing.    Swimming pool and Hot Tub were both ice cold.  Hotel towels have been baked in dryers so many times they feel like sandpaper. Breakfast is a joke and no where near the typical Days Inn chain breakfast brand wide - with no space for a table or chairs. Standing up eating.  Holes in bedspreads.  Looked clean but still felt dirty because of age and worn use.  Horrible entry drive, if not dangerous when you don't know the area. Even my GPS was confused.    Booking this room was a total accident as I read the reviews for the Days Inn just two blocks away that had great reviews, then booked the wrong hotel in

Summary Heading: Doesn't Look at all like their pictures
Summary: Was disappointed.  I was expecting something like the pictures on their website.  It wasn't even close.  Everything was old and outdated.  The shower tiles were cracked and falling apart, tub was rusty, towels looked like the ones I use to wash my car.  I was looking for a clean not very fancy or expensive room because I wasn't going to be there except to sleep.  Was very convenient to Disneyland.  The breakfast was a box of cereal or prepackaged muffins.  You had to ask for milk for the cereal.  When I reserved the room online, I had to prepay to save the rate.  When I checked in, I had to give them my credit card.  I will check my bill to make sure I didn't get charged double.  I probably won't return to this place again.

Bathroom fan didn't work and when I reported it they didn't seem to care.  The bathroom towels were also really rough and scratchy. No signs such as please do not disturb for the door.  The breakfast was rather pathetic with no juice or  no places to sit. It wasn't until the second day that we discovered there was milk but you had to ask for it.  The only positive is it's very close to Disneyland.  Overall, I feel I overpaid for this hotel.

Didn't like that they asked me to pay in full for my trip instead of at checkout like every other hotel. However the staff was nice and accommodating. I wasn't spending much time in the room so didn't mind that it wasn't the most beautiful. I loved that it was in walking distance of the park! Breakfast selection was horrible, not sure how u serve cereal with no milk but you get what you pay for.

This is an older hotel, but overall not bad. The hotel was very quiet, and the rooms were large.  The pool and hot tub were small, but were nice to relax in the afternoon after getting out of the theme parks.  Parking was horrible - the lot was small and half of the spaces were covered, which limited my parking options with a car top carrier on.  Cars were double parked the first morning we got up, but after speaking to the manager, he advised they did have people leave their keys so they could be moved if people needed to get out (a concern for me since we had to leave very early on our check out day).  Breakfast was not a huge selection, but nice to be able to grab some cereal and a muffin before heading out.  The only serious complaint I had was that there were ants in our
The location was great.  Close for parking and also walking.  The rooms were not the cleanest, however.
The management was very good, and we had a good stay.  We left two items in the room and housekeeping turned them into the office.  We were very pleased.

Summary Heading: Great value! 15 minutes walking distance to the tram ride and Downtown Disney district
Summary: Excellent value if you are not looking for a "en grande" accomodation. We decided to save our money on parking and accomodation, but rather splurge it on all the Disney souvenirs and food. Housekeeping keeps the room neat and clean. However, being a clean freak that I am, I sprayed a whole can of Lysol in the bathroom just in case which I do recommend :).

My friend and I stayed there one night for a convention nearby. The front desk personnels are nice, location is pretty convenient to the parks and downtown. However, the facilities are really "outdated", the room smells bad; we also saw ants on the floor. Btw the wifi is slow too..I guess I wont recommend young people to stay here lol.
