We didnt have breakfast there, but took a look when we checked out - they offer cereals in small box(?) and pastries(?) in package : )

The room smelled like cat pee. The breakfast was terrible. Family would not eat it. Location of driveway was horrible it made it hard to get on street. Kids did enjoy the pool and seeing fireworks from our room.

Summary Heading: I was very disappointed with this hotel. There was no...
Summary: I was very disappointed with this hotel. There was no parking for my vehicle when I came back the first night from going out to dinner. The guy working the front desk said no worries and told me to park my car by the front door of the office with my back of car hanging out on the pavement by the highway. We weren't able to get in or out of the passenger side of the car being park there. I was very worried I would get a ticket or have my car broken into. Also our room had several roaches that we found in the bathroom. Overall I was not impressed.

We got to the hotel at 1am and had to walk up to the 3rd floor as the scooter would not be there until 8am that we rented from A scooter 4U much cheaper then Disneys and you get to take it back to your room the hotel manager offered to move our bags down to the 2nd floor closer to the Elevator while we were at the park the room was a bit dated  the room was clean with new sheet's and towels  the breakfast they offered was milk cereal they only had two and some small muffins and coffee no juice is offered the manager told me that orange county changed its law and now everything has to be pre packaged food so they had to take out boiled eggs and waffle station  there is a 711 across the street if you want more then what is offered the walk to Disneyland is not far as you leave the
Very close to Disneyland!! Very basic hotel.  Poor-Fair breakfast! ( no juice, no fruit, no toast, processed,  high calorie packaged muffins, two cereals. Friendy staff!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: It was ok, nothing really bad, but nothing really good.  The pool was dirty and the spa was broke.  The bed were ok. They do the bare min to get by.  Was about a 8-10 min walk to the park. You do get a great view of the fire works!

When we came here there was only 1 parking per room which was ridiculous because we had a guest come visit us & they had no place to park. The nearest parking was a 5 min drive. I had a few family over to visit my son but the owner was not happy that I had guest come over , we weren't making any noise but the manager kept insisting if my guest kept going in & out to smoke a cigarette I would have to get another room which is ridiculous cause we were following the rules to smoke all the way downstairs. Then the next morning he says he's been watching our room the whole night. Never staying here again, the location was amazing cause it was 5 mins always from Disneyland but the service was horrible . Ive never had any issues before with places we've stayed at but here I would not

We arrived. Ppl were nice. Nothing special but it was just right for us. Really close to disneyland. We were able to see the fireworks from the hotel. There were places to eat near by. The parking lot was a bit small and hard to get out of. But overall. Very good experience for us.

The hotel has some much to offer if the owners would clean it up alittle. The swimming pool was dirty as were the rooms.  But for the money what do I expect. The towels that were suppose to be white were a dull gray. Bathroom needs to be alittle more accessible tub didn't work and you couldn't take a bath. The front desk was nice as were the maids.

Summary Heading: Great if you Like dirty Rooms and rundown property
Summary: First I would like to stay we tried to change hotels but everyone was Booked , so we made due with this horrible hotel.We visit Disneyland about every 3 months , we spend very little time in our room so fancy is not important to us , we really only care about location and how clean the property is , Clean is the most important   Arrived early for a 3 night stay , surprised to find our room ready , assigned room on bottom floor right in front of pool ,room had a odd smell when we first entered , a little muggy , a little perfumie , kind of stale. I always do my pre check before i bring my bags into the room, my  eyes first saw the brownish stain on the wall near the ceiling , checked the bathroom and was surprised to find it very clean , continued checking the rest of room and

hotel is so so. but the accommodation is much appreciated. found out the ART shuttle system does not drop off at their hotel anymore, but it was just about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the mickey and friends parking structure, which isn't so bad.  would still pick this one on our next stay.
Where to begin. Black mold in the bathroom. Door latch didn't work right and informed the front desk. The solution? Wiggle the handle when you insert card. Safe to say we won't be back

The hotel was in bad repair. If we had not prepaid we would have left. Shameful to the owners, for even renting out rooms. Toilet floods constantly, walls damaged, filth, carpets so bad we had to wear shoes.

We stayed as a family in the 3 queen bedroom and the stay was very pleasant. We extended the stay by 2 more days. Great staff, value breakfast and location. Walking distance to Disneyland tram stop made it one of the easiest access ever. Will definitely consider staying again.

AC barely worked, ok for cleanliness Hard to find for smallest hotel sign ever The last driveway before Disneyland Dr. When east bound on Ball. Very noisy. Right next to Disney fireworks. Would not stay here again.

Summary Heading: close to Disney, but not that good
Summary: towels were dingy, didn't look clean...Pool was green the first day we got there. The hotel guy said the pool was green because of the wind and that the pool guy just hadn't come that day. It would have taken more time than what he was saying for the walls to have grown moss. Pool is really small. Shower/tub looked moldy. Could have at least been re caulked to get rid of the grime

SUPER close to the park! We walked to Disneyland's main gate in less than 20 minutes. You can also see the fireworks perfectly from the balconies at 930pm, but be warned, if you have little ones sleeping before this they may wake up as the fireworks are extremely loud and sound like cannon fire (they startled me until I realized what was going on). When I return to Disneyland I will consider staying at this hotel again for easy access to the park.  Parking lot is small, maybe enough parking spots for one car per hotel room.  Breakfast area looked super small, so we picked up some fruit and granola bars for breakfast when we picked up food for Disneyland the night we checked in. We didn't even bother going to see what they were serving.  Pool looked small, but the children
We stayed at this hotel because it was easy walking distance to Disney trams.   It met our needs for this weekend but probably will not stay here again.  The carpets needed a good cleaning.
For the price, not bad. Only issue was the TINY parking lot that was hell trying to squeeze into and the THIN walls. But the rooms were nice and the bed was very comfy. Hotel staff was splendid.
So close to Disney Land, you would think they would keep the rooms clean and looking nice. Parking sucks and towels are probably 10 years old cuz they feel like sand paper.

Summary Heading: Not clean,  disappointed. Have since stayed twice since this picture because it is a great location and price.
Summary: Least favorite of any nearby hotel we have personally tried.  No discount was given or even apologies for the room cleanliness,  and pool wasn't locked at gate,  (as was nightly at pool close)  so our daughter and another guests daughter were in the spa!  Yuk

Very close to Disney (we walked every day).  This is good for getting to the park and bad if you want to sleep or have a conversation during the fireworks show each night.  There is also quite a bit of road noise, as it is on a major street.  The room was comfortable, but nothing fancy.  The bed was comfortable.  For those who need it, there is a good sized mini refrigerator and a microwave.  The towels were like sandpaper.  Overall, I'd stay there again for the value and the closeness to Disney.

Summary Heading: For Budget travellers, closest to Disney...
Summary: We could see Disney land fireworks every night from our room,,,it's that close to the Disney land.  We could walk up to there in 10 minutes.  Great for budget travellers, one doesn't have to hire cab to reach Disney . Breakfast is basic, served in the little lobby...Don't expect a great spread.   Each room is equipped with a large counter with a sink, outside the bathroom, where we can spread our handbags. Bathroom is tiny but clean.  Best part is that the reception helps you order the food from other restaurants. Very good facility for Indian Vegetarian  Travellers.  Only flipside is that the room window opens onto the common corridor, so the curtains have to be always shut for privacy.

You get what you pay for.  This is definitely a 2 star hotel.   Cons: Rooms were kept clean however the carpet was gross and I didn't want bare feet on it.  We had the room with 3 queens and there was a sofa in the room that was very old and gross.  We asked for a blanket so we could cover it and the blanket was clean however it had several stains on it.   Pool was very small and unheated and dirty and my kids did not want to swim. The breakfast was poor... cold cereal (2 same options everyday), pre wrapped muffins, and what they consider hot breakfast was they offered hot water to make instant oatmeal.  This was the breakfast offered every day.    Pros: Great location to Disneyland with a 6 minute walk to trams that take you to main gate. Staff was very nice and easy to work

The only positive thing I can say is at least the sheets were clean. The floors and walls were grungy and dirty. The bathtub was stained with rust.  The hot tub had "stuff" growing in it. The door malfunctioned and wouldn't open. The Continental breakfast consisted of coffee, boxed cereal and"requested" milk cartons (only 1 power guest).  It was a horrible experience and I canceled our upcoming reservations.
It's close to the park.  Can see fireworks.  Small pool.  Rooms are okay.  The staff is super nice.  I'm serous.  Super nice.  Parking is tight.

This hotel is perfect location for a quick 7 minute walk through the Disneyland parking garage to the trams which whisk you to the front entry gates.  The fireworks are absolutely right in front of this hotel just across the street about 100 yards back.  This hotel has a suite with three queen size beds to accomodate a larger family.  Good room cleaning staff keep things tidy and clean.  The breakfast included is oatmeal, coffee, muffins, tea, frosted flakes or raisin bran cereal with milk.  There are no fruits or vegetables included with breakfast even though California is rich with reasonable priced fruits.  The swimming pool is crystal clear and 72 degrees cold.  The hot tub is brownish water at 106 degrees hot.  We would stay at this hotel again due to its proximity to

Location is within walking distance to Disneyland but nothing else. I was traveling with an 87 year old and 4 year old. No restraunts in walking distance. Hot tub/spa did not work and looked nasty. Pool too cold to swim in. I was really hoping to have something for the 4 year old to do after a long car ride.   With that being said, rooms were clean, office staff friendly and felt very safe in the area.  Bring your own towels, theirs are the worst   Seriously, freeway right out your door.   Location and lack if advertised spa/pool was only setback to our mini vacation.

I've stayed here before and will do so again. The staff is very friendly and the room are clean. The place is older but I am usually at Disneyland all day from opening to closing so all I'm really doing is sleeping a few hours before getting up and going again.

We enjoyed staying at the hotel because of it's convenient location. Unfortunately that was the best part of it. The room was nice and had a nice big beds but the carpet was absolutely filthy and left the bottom of our feet black. There was Absolutely no water pressure in the shower which made it very difficult to take showers in a short amount time. We had four people in the room so it took a long time. The staff was very nice and helpful with any concerns that we had. The continental breakfast was nice but basic. I recommend this place to anybody that's looking for a very convenient place to stay we going to Disneyland and not spending a lot of money.
Property is outdated and rooms need work. First room had adjoining door and there was no way to safely secure the inside door to our room.

Summary Heading: Great location but just average room
Summary: We have stayed at several hotels in the area surrounding Disneyland. The room was just average. There was a carpet patch on the floor by the freestanding closet. Great location by the park but not a close walk. Signage was difficult to see to find entrance. Probably will not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Don't Judge A Book By It's Cover
Summary: The staff are so nice and accommodating. The hotel isn't new or pretty, but it was a comfortable close to Disney place to stay. We were very happy with our visit and will return to this hotel next time.

We stayed here last year and we were very satisfied. This year we wanted to stay again. We found out they have a three bed room ,so we only needed two rooms this year. That saved money. We walked to Disneyland and when we were at our room, we saw the beautiful fireworks .No ,it's not fancy, but clean and friendly.
VERY convenient. Walking distance to Disneyland. Make sure you take the route to the parking garage otherwise your 5 min walk turns into a 20min walk

Summary Heading: Stay at Days Inn Annaheim West
Summary: The hotel was reasonably clean and the staff was extremely pleasant and friendly.  Although the towels smelled of bleach, they were very coarse and grayish.  Some of the face cloths you could actually see through they were so thin.  Breakfast was a very limited offering compared to other places that offer a breakfast as part of the stay.  As I left after a six day stay, I reported that the tub was draining slowly.  The shower curtain was improperly hung--making for a flood each time I took a shower since it could not be closed.

The room was good but the parking was a nightmare. We checked in about 1 am and there was no parking available. The man at the front desk told us to just park in front of the office. Then by 7 am they were blowing up the rooms phone wanting us to move it.

We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. we chose to drive each day just because we ate breakfast and dinner away from the park but it is close to enough to walk to the shuttles if you wanted to. The hotel was decent, it is old and in need of an upgrade. The only complaints are the shower was a little small and the beds were VERY firm. It is very close to the park so when the fireworks go off at night and if you are back at the hotel plug your ears because it is VERY loud. Parking is limited and tight so if you drive a big vehicle practice your parking skills. There is free Wi-Fi but it is a bit slow, I recommend anything you need to do on internet (i.e. business) wait until you get home. If you are looking for an affordable place to rest your

Horrible from the parking lot.  Room carpet was dirty.  One of the rooms had an old ac unit behind the table.  Towels were like sand paper. The water faucet in the bathroom starts of sounding like a machine gun.  And our rate wasn't great.  No stars here.
In need of TLC!!!  Most of the lamps didn't work, in dire need of some updating, parking was tight but staff was very nice.

The carpet wrecked our socks by turning them black. The linens were washed in a strong detergent but not rinsed well enough resulting an a whole body rash and a trip to the urgent care. The breakfast was pitiful consisting of disgusting muffins and cereal without milk. The pool (which I called to confirm was open) had a broken heater, so the pool was technically open, but gave my kids headaches when they tried to use it. The front desk staff are unable to communicate by phone.
Hotel wasn't bad, really close to Disneyland just walk around the back of the hotel next door and down the lot to Disney.

Summary Heading: found a new home away from home
Summary: very friendly staff, it's older but it still has it's charm. room was always clean. close to disneyland didn't need the buss was a short walk to the tram and straight in.

Summary Heading: was ok, VERY close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is clean and nice enough. Is on the corner of very busy roads though so a lot of traffic noise. We got two rooms , one with two beds and one with three. The room pictured three beds all in one room but that is not what it was. It actually was a suite with the two beds in one room and one in another. If we had known that we could have gotten away with getting just that one room instead of paying for two. Charge was a little higher then expected. I figured it was just tax but I thought that this site I got it from included that in the price. Is super close to Disneyland so if you don't plan on spending a lot of time there this is very convenient. You are about two blocks away from the Disneyland parking garage so you can go there and catch the tram over to Downtown

Summary Heading: Close to Disney...but spend $20 more to stay elsewhere
Summary: First - we aren't hotel snobs, we just have standards.    Second - if you're going to run a business in the hospitality industry, be hospitable and take care of your clients.   We've stayed in most of the hotels surrounding Disneyland, never have we experienced the issues we had here. I could easily rant, but I will save you some time. Here's what we experienced.   - Bed sheets seemed unchanged or were so old they still had urine stains on them. (Photo attached.  Stain was over one foot in diameter)   - management handed me two cleaner sheets to remake bed myself.   - bathtub hardly drained, almost a foot of water in tub at end of shower.   - side table was sticky  - side chair stained  - hairdryer was old and shut off due to over heating after less than 30 seconds  All in all,

Summary Heading: walking distance to magic kingdom tram
Summary: The room was standard.  Clean and well maintained.  What made our stay a great one was the office staff.  They were SO nice and really accommodating of our every request.  Save money on parking, it is close enough to walk.  Only complaint is the small parking lot that is impossible to exit into flow of traffic.  Still s great value.

I was surprised by the microwave and fridge in the room. The beds and pillows were soft. Perfect view for Disney fireworks. The breakfast was cereal, muffins, and coffee (no drinks for kids). Tram was less than ten minutes walking (ask the front desk where to go). Overall, it was a decent stay to enjoy Disney.

Summary Heading: The staff was very helpful and great. The hotel location is...
Summary: The staff was very helpful and great. The hotel location is close to the park which was nice. I noticed a lot of dust, built up dirt, stains and uncleanliness of the bathroom and room.

Pool and hot tub were closed for no apparent reason. No information in hotel whatsoever, so we didn't know that the breakfast ended at 9a. Breakfast was very basic and not worth it. Towels were rough. You can see fireworks from the balcony, which did improve the stay.
This hotel is very convenient as it is close to Disneyland parking. Only 5 minutes walking to Disneyland parking and you can take Disney tram to Disneyland main gate.

Towels were old and rough, breakfast was terrible because it consisted of cereal, stale muffins, coffee.  Bathtub had an old dirty mat which caused me to slip and hurt my leg because it was very slippery.  Another family member also slipped in the bathtub.  Toilet was not functioning, made a load noise when flushed.  I will never stay there again.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: We spent some points to stay for free at this hotel near disneyland for one night. Like some other reviewers mentioned, this hotel is a cheap place to rest before heading out to the parks. It's old, kinda smelly, kinda scary, and the beds aren't very comfortable. Shower worked fine, hot and good pressure, but the overall accommodation was disappointing. Free breakfast was a joke, all that was included was a muffin. Management was friendly and helped us get a room at 11pm (because AMEX screwed up my reservation and booked us for the wrong night). Overall I would not stay here again, but stay closer to the park at either the Ramada or the Tropicana over there. The walk to the parks from this hotel is pretty far, and you'll be walking all day at disneyland already so your feet will

Summary Heading: If you are too tired to care
Summary: Close walk to parking trams and great view for Disney fireworks and parking accommodation for 2 cars, but carpet turned our feet black, luggage rack collapsed when luggage placed on it, tile in shower grout dirty and fixed badly, towels cousins to sandpaper (only 5 in the room holding 6 people) beds very hard But we were safe and had a place to lay our tired heads but WAY TOO EXPENSIVE for the quality😪

I read the reviews and decided to listen to those that noted the friendliness of the staff and proximity to Disneyland. They were absolutely right and more. May I add that I stayed here for 11 days in a row to exhaust my Disneyland annual Pass before it expired.  I've stayed at other motels across the road from this one, but this was the first to tell me that the Disneyland Parking Lot tram was just around the corner. So easy! Mind you the walk from the motel to Downtown Disney is all of 12-15 mins at a leisurely pace.  The staff was very accommodating. I I arrived very late due to a delayed flight and was able to ring for the night manager who helped me right away. My room was a smoking room (I do not smoke - just was cheaper) and it did not smell of smoke at all. Not a bug in
I don't recommend this hotel. It was outdated and in need of remodel. It mentioned a continental breakfast which was non-existent.
Very old outdated small not very clean the breakfest was terrible the microwave had never been cleaned only  plus is a 10 to 15 minute walk to the downtown disney.

Summary Heading: Everything was great except for the service, the front desk...
Summary: Everything was great except for the service, the front desk man must have been having a REALLY bad day...

Cold cereal and dry muffins for breakfast. No fruit and had to share a milk with family. Water for hot tea tasted bitter.  Heater/AC stopped working. Bathroom was old, chipped bathtub painted over. Mildew was clear grouted over. Building was hard to find as trees block the Hotel Logo. Driveway is difficult to get in and out of. Driveway is at  the turn lane of Disney Drive and W Ball Road, if traffic allows you can get out to go through the light, but if not, you can only turn right onto Disney Drive. Even after discussing that I had a handicapped child, we were put on the third floor.  Beds were comfortable, which was a surprise. Staff did not let me know that the Fireworks are right across the street and the noise is so loud you think you are under attack. It rattled the

Summary Heading: Poor property but very good location.
Summary: They offer breakfast and is just bad coffee and muffins no tables to eat.... We visit cheaper Hotels with more better breakfast service. The rooms are Ok but the towels are soooooo old when you try to dry you get scrathes. Is a poor propiety but is a good location to visit Disneyland Resort.

There are a handful of things about this place that weren't so great.  Mostly about the property.  The walk to Disneyland isn't bad at all but that might just be me.  The staff was awesome.  Simple as that.  The room wasn't so great but I was in a smaller room with a king sized bed.  Next time around I'll try a double queen room.  Yes, there will be a next time.  Watchout on google maps.  They tell you that there is a disneyland drive entrance to the motel.  That's a long way to go for the Uturn.

I had read reviews that the staff here was short and not nice but I decided to try it out anyway.  I don't know if they have new management now or what but the guy at the front desk was so super friendly.  He was great and very accommodating.  We drove down early before check-in to get to Disney before it opened.  They let us park our car there and told us how to get to the free tram that Disney offers at the Mickey and Friends parking structure.  It was a 5 minute walk.  That night when we got back super late he was there and asked us how the park was.  We had a room with 3 queens and it was perfect for us.  Breakfast was not great but we ate enough to fill us.  We would definitely stay here again.  It is close to Disney, clean, roomy and friendly!

Summary Heading: Lowest Price Room I Could Find
Summary: I chose to stay at Days Inn West because, I was looking for a very close and cheap place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  This was cheapest place I found, and was fairly close to an ART/Bus Stop (allowed me to get to/from DL with minimal walking/crossing one crosswalk, and riding bus/shuttle for approx $5 per day, and running every 30 minutes.)  Hotel and Housekeeping Staff was friendly.  Timeliness of service requested i.e. housekeeping, could have been better, but was fair/as expected for this price/value.  Room was not the most up-to-date in decor but had comfortable bed, clean linens, microwave and refrigerator.  Floors/carpet and ceiling had considerable about of dirt/dust, some cobwebs behind curtains, but again... as expected for such low price per night.  Good place
Bathroom was clogged. Not good. Washer and dryer room is not neat. Days Inn shouldnt' have these kinda franchises. Breakfast was very minimal.

Summary Heading: Employee at front desk was very rude and unhelpful. One key...
Summary: Employee at front desk was very rude and unhelpful. One key did not work and employee made me come 30 mins to try the other, which also did not work. Did not apologize.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, clean room and the location was great! Only...
Summary: Friendly staff, clean room and the location was great! Only negative was how loud the road works were. Would wake us up at 6am each weekday morning. But overall I would 100% stay at this location again!

I understand these are not high quality hotels, but the towels we had in the military felt like silk compared to the cheese grater texture of these towels. The beds were in need of replacing as well. If these two things were good I could care less about the rest. I would also recommend a carpet cleaning or replacement, my feet shouldn't turn black after walking from the bed to the bathroom.

Summary Heading: My only complaint would be the carpet should be cleaned. it...
Summary: My only complaint would be the carpet should be cleaned. it appeared clean/vacuumed..no debris visible. But turned the bottom of socks black

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but hotel needs help.
Summary: The room was spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 little ones. Came with a refrigerator and microwave. That's where the good ended. Beds were very uncomfortable, pillows were lumpy and carpets were filthy. Very loud street noise and construction noise from the park made sleeping in impossible. The continental breakfast was one packaged danish, coffee and 2 kinds of cereal. Staff was friendly, but this hotel could use some love. Pool and hot tub looked filthy too.
We were right off of harbor next to Disneyland entrance awesome price very clean will use again for sure.

Toilet didnt flush, remote didnt work. Fireworks for disneyland going off behind room enough to shake room. Kids bouncing on floor all night upstairs. Got NO sleep!!! Breakfast had muffins and cereal but no milk. Otherwise room was clean. Not a bad walk to disneyland trams.

Will definitely stay there again!!!! Easy walk great price! Great to sleep,pretty quite  maids/staff were very helpful! Cons tough to get out on to the Main Street but parking was great especially whe. You look at the hotel next door! Wow what a mess! Towels a bit rough and breakfast times not sure but the one day cold cereal and muffin we were good with ! Hold you over until lunch . Will definitely stay there agai !!!! Easy laundry facilities also especially with kidos! It's about a 10 to 15 min east wAlk and a great value!!

If you want a place to lay your head after an exhausting day running around Disneyland then this is your hotel! It's not luxurious, it's not perfect BUT the beds are comfortable, the water pressure is good, the linens and towels are clean, and the TV works!

Although within a short 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney, this hotel is in serious need of upgrades. Although not the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, it def. wasn't up to par with other hotels in the area.

The only thing missing was roaches.  The hotel do NOT  have elevators.   Be ready to carry all luggage upstairs. We asked for help and we're ready to tip, no help.    The room was dirty and outdated. It was in great need of repair.  The shuttle did NOT have seat belts and shuttled children.  They over deaths the 15 passenger van.   The shuttle ran on their own schedule and did not run all the time Disneyland was open.  We walked home at 12am because there was no ride.   Pay a bit more.

We have traveled to Anaheim many times in the past 35 years for a family vacation time. Days Inn Disneyland West is my favorite place to stay. The Motel crew (Maintenance Man, Desk Manager and Maids) do an excellent job of taking care of the customer. Rooms are older but well maintained.  The walking distance from DIDW to the Disneyland Tram is a short 10 min.  Motel Room pricing is great and about half the cost of other motels in the area. Thank you for the great stay and we will see you again next time we visit your area.  Mike

The motel is older and could use some updating.  There were ice buckets under the coolers outside almost every room.  For the price, we were very close to Disneyland!  The fireworks were amazing from our balcony.  It would also be nice to have the internet access code in the room.  We had to ask for it to use it.

Well the shuttle "bus" is someone's falling apart van..to open the sliding door in the back they have to open the front passenger door and reach back.. Seat belts don't work... So brace yourself for possible sudden impacts. If they get to Disneyland on time, that is. Or else pay the 8$ the cabbies charge... Or walk. Manager on hand doesn't like to hear criticism or hear about what happens... This is where the title of the review comes in... We stayed and my 2 hear old son  brought his favorite Toy Story toy... Woody...the one with the pull string in the  back... Well just like in the Halloween episode where the iguana steels the toys, one of their employees stole my sons Woody toy, but left his hat... My wife became hysterical about it, and this was after us having to walk back

Summary Heading: Not a place I would ever stay again!
Summary: Ants all over the place (woke up with one crawling on my face), towels that feel like bar rags, smelly and dirty, in need of significant repairs.  Free breakfast? Well, if packaged muffins, warm milk for cereal, and some toast counts...then, I guess it does. The pool was tiny and right by the parking lot...not fun.  I do not complain about places that I stay...however, this one was bad enough that I will never go back and encourage others to find another hotel. $85 a night was a complete rip-off!!

Summary Heading: The staff was friendly.  The room was clean and what may be...
Summary: The staff was friendly.  The room was clean and what may be expected for a two star hotel.  The only thing that made the hotel amazing was how close you could see the firework show at the nearby amusement park.  Parking was horrible and very, very limited.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We needed room for 6, and the Days Inn Anaheim West had a room with three full beds, so we booked even though the reviews werent so great. My experience was the same as many others...Room was so dirty (but not the bed linens, luckily). Ants in the bathroom. Breakfast was a joke. Front desk staff was super friendly and helpful, however. We got what we paid for. Next trip, we wont be so cheap, and we will book at a nicer hotel with better reviews.

The staff was very nice enjoyed the breakfast but the milk wasnt cold enough and the ran out of waffle mix the hotel was very basic access to the laundry room was a plus but the location was a 10 minute walk to the disneyland tram and on the third day it was difficult for us the price of the stay was nice and the need to supply conditioner in there toiletries

Disappointed with the room conditions. 1.  There was a 1/2 inch gap between the bathroom door and the door frame, so there was not complete privacy in the bathroom.  It was not discovered until after we had unpacked and we were ready to go to bed.  Did not report it because we did not want to have to change room. 2.  The room floor was filthy.  After taking a shower and washing our feet, we would walk on the room floor and our feet turned black from the dirty carpets. 3.  There was trash under the bed and along the wall behind the bed headboard -- including condom wrappers, dust bunnies, and general trash.  This is not a very inviting situation. 4.  The continental breakfast was a farce.  We had stayed at another Days Inn a couple of years ago.  The continental breakfast

The carpet has an almost slimy feel to it. It was really disgusting. We actually bought flip-flops to wear in the hotel room. My wife and I both started coughing after our first day there. The shower head was barely functioning, and I had to spend time trying to change the mode, worried that it would fall off. Parking was also a mess.Also, breakfast was non-existent. We went down one day and they we out of food (even orange juice).  With all that being said, the staff was helpful, friendly, and moved their car to give us a space to park on more than one occasion.

Do not expect this motel to be modern.  It should have been torn down in the 70's.  Toilet made a loud whistling sound when you flushed.  Continental breakfast looked so terrible that we ate at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A good place to sleep and close to Disneyland, other than...
Summary: A good place to sleep and close to Disneyland, other than that don't expect much. Not a lot of breakfast options. The room was dirty. There was a large dead but under one of the beds. The pool and hot tub were not kept up at all.

Summary Heading: Toilets were really small and low to the floor and hardly...
Summary: Toilets were really small and low to the floor and hardly any outlets to plug in your devices

I stayed at this Days Inn during my trip to Disneyland and really liked it.I loved this hotel and the location. The room IS  big, clean, simple, comfortable,and  free WIFI. complimentary continental breakfast.

I just recently stayed at this hotel and i must say i was pleased. It was about a ten minute walk from Disney Land & California Adventure and and pleasant walk at that. The staff was very nice and helpful, the room was clean and well kept with free wifi and surprisingly quiet. The continental breakfast was not bad, could have had a little more choices but over all it was ok and this place wasn't bad. I would stay here again and it was a good price to be so close to Disney.

This hotel was so disgusting. After spending a long say at Disney I came back to my room, to have ants everywhere. They were coming from the bathroom to the counter to the TV Stand. The ants were in all of my things, my suitcase,  all of my makeup, my souvenirs, everything.  I called the front desk to ask what to do with the ants and the employee did not seem to care. He brought over "windex" to kill the ants, and he expected me to do it. After realizing there was ants in the bed I called the front desk asking to be moved to another room. Which the employee did. And when I got in that room I noticed there was something on the pillows and bed,  when I looked it was bed bugs. I took a picture and showed the employee and he acted like I was completely wrong and was very rude to me.

When we arrived we rang the bell to check in and no one answered. After waiting a few minutes we had to call the hotel to finally get help.  3 days later after spending the entire day at Disneyland we come back to our room to find it infested with ants. The bathroom floor was covered as well as most of our luggage. After calling the front desk he brought over a bottle of Windex for us to kill the ants. After a few moments we noticed that they were ask over the bed to so we asked for a different room.  The new room looked fine at first until my girlfriend noticed a beatle on one if the pillows. Upon closer inspection we realized that there were bed bugs in both of  the beds in our new room. We immediately checked out and had to drive home in the middle of the night.

Summary Heading: Staff was great, Improvements needed on property
Summary: Front desk service was great. The room was a little dirty when we got here. There were hairs in our bed and bathroom didn't looked wiped down. The Pool definitely needs to be resurfaces, pool was not inviting at all. Parking is very tight and difficult when you have a truck  Again Staff and service was great though. Will most likely stay again and recommend due to staff and location.

Was originally going to stay here our entire trip of 8 days. Would only tolerate it 1 night. It is old and run down, it is dirty, hated to even sleep and shower here. Pool is disgusting, would never allow my children to step foot in it. We were able to get a refund after 1 night stay, however after checking out realized we were charged for 2 nights. It has been over a week since our stay here and have been arguing the charge with the hotel ever since. So disappointing that this hotel thinks it can get by with charging people this much per night just because it is very close to Disney. If Walt himself knew what hotels in the vicinity of his park were doing to those traveling to his park, I am sure he would be very disappointed too! Do yourself a favor, save your money and go stay
Parking lot small and under leaks in building. Limited breakfast selection and no seating to eat. Bathtub had some mold.

The motel needs to shampoo their floors. Both times we have stayed at this motel the floors turned our feet black, the bathroom floor was sticky. The water for the bath would not stay in and the water dripped all night. The parking lot is very tight and it is very hard to get out of it because it's on the corner of two busy streets. We had a great view of the fireworks from Disneyland and if your going there its not too far of a walk. The beds were comfortable and the room was big.

Summary Heading: My stay at Disney Days Inn
Summary: We arrived at the Hotel Desk at 1:30 in the morning after driving nearly 9 hours from the San Francisco Bay Area.  Upon pressing the door bell is was less than 10 seconds and the Attendant was there calling me in. I informed him I needed a lavatory and he allowed me to use the Employees. Room. He was very helpful about how to get to Disneyland's Parking Lot (which by the way was virtually 300 yards away), he was very knowledgeable about Restaurants, Gas Stations (and prices). Our Room was very clean, and the beds were very comfortable.  The Elevator was fast with no jerking.  Finally the Parking Lot was very roomy. Overall, I would classify our stay as very fortuitous.  Making me a very happy Great Uncle, because my Great Nephew was very happy. One other thing....Our Room was

I have stayed at Days Inn in multiple locations across the US, but this one was definitely my least favourite. My friends and I stayed here for a fun trip to Disneyland, and we were very surprised by what we got. The towels were scratchy, the table was old, uneven, and had stains on it. Only one of the lamps between the bed worked, and even then, the switch was awful and only worked if you twisted it 6 or 7 times. There weren't very many outlets near the beds for alarm clocks. The continental breakfast wasn't breakfast. There was toast, waffles, and two types of cereal, along with poor coffee and my friends said the orange juice tasted gross. We're in our early 20s, so we should've been easy to please. Also, the 7-minute walk is more like 15 (not that that made a big difference

Summary Heading: Room was spacious, bit expensive, it is three blocks from...
Summary: Room was spacious, bit expensive, it is three blocks from the disneyland and we can walk to the park easily.
The facility was very old and looked like a worn out farm house. The room was dirty with food crumbs unerneath the bed. The keys never worked. Over all very bad experience.
Kept socks on when walking on carpet. Did not use the shower as it looked grimy and gross. Will shell out more $ for a better hotel next time.

Unfortunately our room was very hot and to "fix" the problem we were given a portable fan to help circulate the warm air. While the additional room we had was super cold, we just had to deal with the heat for the entire stay because the hotel was booked.

Summary Heading: This hotel has a lot to learn
Summary: This hotel was horrible. The room was not up to par and I didn't feel safe. My door frame was broke so I couldn't lock the deadbolt and the other lock to allow partial opening of the door was also broke. I did not enjoy my stay and will never stay at this hotel again.

It is a budget hotel, with basic rooms. I liked that there is a microwave in the room, saved on meals a couple of the night. The AC, wifi and tv worked wonderfully. Like most other reviewers comment on, the carpets could do with a really good clean. You get cereal, toast, waffles and juice to take back to your room for breakfast.  You get a wonderful view of the Disney fireworks. Don't try and get to sleep before the fireworks though, they will wake you up. Extremely loud and the vibration goes through the whole building.  It is close to Disneyland, possibly not close enough for people with young children though.  I enjoyed the stay at Days Inn Disneyland West

We booked this place because of it's 3 queen bed option. Room had no AC which was apparently unfixable. Couldn't open the windows because the room was bordered by busy streets with loud traffic all night. Tough night for sleeping.

Summary Heading: Everything was a ok but the bath towels are terrible. It's...
Summary: Everything was a ok but the bath towels are terrible. It's like the quality of a dusting cloth, we had better quality on the next day but I wish that you would improve on that aspect

Breakfast consisted of toast and there was no seating. You had to take the toast to your room or elsewhere. Room was old, entrances dirty, room dated and dirty. The only thing good was it was a place to sleep at 3:00 am when others were full and it was very close to Disney.

The location was very good to DisneyLand.  You could walk if you wanted to.  The staff were very nice.   The breakfast was okay.  Cold cereal, bread for toast and you could make waffles if you wanted.  You could see DisneyLand fireworks from our third floor walkway.  The wifi wasn't very good. The carpet was so dirty in our room, as soon as you got out of the shower and walked on it your feet were black. We couldn't let the baby crawl on the floor without putting the comforters down for him to crawl. The bathroom had paint peeling off the walls, chippings tiles, and rust around the tub fixture.  The room also had a smell to it.  I've stayed in alot nicer hotels for less money.  My suggestion is don't stay here.

The rooms were clean as well as the property. It got a little loud when the fireworks went on right over the hotel.  The only problem I had was when I went back to the hotel and my door was left opened from the house keepers. They didn't close the door tight enough for it to lock.

This was the worst hotel experience. The hotel gives Days Inn which I consider a very good hotel chain a bad name. The hotel was in serious disrepair, the lighting was poor electrical hazard, the towels were dingy, the table was ricketty, a steal odor was present there was no eye appeal. the best thing about this hotel was the Gideon Bible. The only reason I did not demand a refund was that we had travelled , it was late at night and we were too tired to be upset. I have come to expect a certain standard from the chain and was disappointed that it was not met.

Summary Heading: Room very clean , comfy. Only disappointment was driving in...
Summary: Room very clean , comfy. Only disappointment was driving in and out of hotel. Too close to corner.
My stay was pleasant. The room was clean. The people who worked there were friendly and helpful. The bed was alright, but I could feel the springs, so that was my least favorite part.
The hotel was in a very good location.  Literally walking distance.  The hotel ifs not at all fancy and the towels are like bark. But not a bad price for the area.

The a.c. unit didn't work right it made the room very very humid. That was very uncomfortable. The walk to the tram through the cast parking lot made it easy to get to Disneyland. The hot tube was dirty and pool area wasn't locked. The toilet would shake every time you got up.  Waffles were OK for breakfast if you got there between 7-9 a.m.

The light of the entry sign was not lit despite it being 2 hours after sunset, so I missed the entry and spent 10 minutes looping back to enter the parking area.  The clerk was courteous but unconcerned and unapologetic about the light.  The glass windows and draperies of the room must have been very poor quality because the street noise poured in all night making this the worst motel stay i ever had!

I let my son find a hotel close to the entrance to Disneyland and he found it. I  give it 3 dots only because of the convenience and the lack of need for your car. The room we had was clean, bleached pink toilet seat and all. It was just basic without any frills old style motel bedspread and basic linens. The towels were horrible and felt like sandpaper from years of laundering but there was a flat screen tv which surprised me. The hotel had a pool which looked clean however we never used it, the general upkeep of the motel was poor, the fact that it was on the corner of Disneyland Way and Ball Rd and it only took us 20 minutes to walk to the main gate makes it a keeper. Don't expect the four seasons or even a Marriott because it's not, it's a Days Inn in Anaheim.

We have stayed with Wyndham Hotels before when we come up to have fun at Disneyland.  But, the prices have going through the roof and all of them.  However, AT Days Inn on Ball & Disney Drive we found a small yet comfortable hotel.  The room was big, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was large.  We will come back to this hotel in the future.

Dirty room , filthy carpet, all of the outside of the hotel dirty, bathroom dirty, uncomfortable beds, called housekeeping for 2 extra pillows and I never got them. I stayed for 2 days.. Awful experience!

Summary Heading: Great location for walking to Disney
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disney and knotts Berry Farm. Great location for parks. Comfy beds. Very modest we place but was perfect for sleeping. Breakfast every morning included cereal , toast, waffles , coffee so was handy and great. Would def stay again

Summary Heading: Loved how close this was to Disneyland & California...
Summary: Loved how close this was to Disneyland & California Adventure. Internet did not work very well. Also the bathroom could use some maintance, the toilet moves and the shower drain is very slow.

Summary Heading: comfortable,  affordable within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: Although an old hotel, it was clean, comfortable and the staff were helpful.  We appreciated the breakfast selections.

Summary Heading: It works for what it is.
Summary: Nothing exciting about this hotel. Booked it due to them having a room big enough for 6. Breakfast was just toast, waffles, cereal, juice, or coffee and tea. Thought there would at least be some danishes or something else. Ended up going to the store to buy some fruits and yogurt. The pool is tiny though. The driveway is right before a light so if you blink you might miss it. Would probably stay again.

The motel is great as a place to sleep after long days at Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure parks. You're within a couple of blocks of the free Disney tram service at the Disney parking structure, which is just south of the Days Inn on Disneyland Drive, and that shortens you're walking distance. There's ample free parking at the motel (some under a roofed area) if you're driving to Los Angeles. Not great for breakfast (waffles, toast, cereal), but okay (and small, so you'll want to eat in your room---or somewhere else). Rooms are and decor are older, but fine, with elevator to 2nd and 3rd floors. If you're staying here for Disney, you won't be in your room except to sleep. Staff is friendly and helpful. The driveway is right at the corner of Ball and Disneyland Drive

The only decent thing about this place was the location. Not too far from Disneyland. Was hoping it would be just as presentable as the pictures... But it looked like a dump. There was a black hair on my toilet seat. There was trash in the trash can already from a previous guest. There was hair on the non slip mat for the shower. I was absolutely disgusted. The TV sat on top of the microwave which made me fear for my son that was staying with me. The clerk at the front desk was MIA for who knows how long while I stood there and rung the bell waiting to be approached. Would never stay here again.

First off, there were eight of us. When I called, I asked if we could have three rooms close . David said call the day before and he would try. Well ,we got two adjoining rooms and one two doors down. The rooms were clean and we all agreed the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was just right , if you want fruit, bring some. We walked everyday except the last day. It is very close. Overall, eight people, five days and three  rooms at a great price. Yes, we will stay there again. Such a nice surprise ,we were able to view Disney's fireworks  right out our door.

Yes, this motel is old but we found our room to be clean, the carpet new, and the bed comfortable. The sheets and towels were thin from many washings but were clean. The room had a hairdryer, a refrigerator, a microwave and a steel structures with hangers for our clothes. On Friday and through the weekend the fireworks seen from the balcony are beautiful. The staff was very nice in answering our questions. We didn’t try the small continental breakfast as full breakfast restaurants were nearby on Harbor. We walked to a hotel at the corner of Ball and Harbor where a shuttle took us to the Disneyland entrance. We walked back to the motel from Downtown Disney. Parking was ample during our three night stay. Friends stayed in the room next door and could not hear our TV, so the walls
Although the property is older, it is apparent that maintenance is a high priority.  The rooms are exceptionally clean, and the staff is extremely courteous and helpful.
Stayed here before. Always convenient and safe.  I arrived early for check in and they managed to get me a room before the time to check in. Very nice

Over priced, the free breakfast was a loaf of bread, and some watered down OJ. I have stayed at other Days Inn and the breakfast was a lot better. Not sure if this is a chain, or privately owned. But that was one bad thing. Also, in laundry room there were old monitors and junk stored in that room, there was also old junk laying outside under the parking. The rooms were dirty, and I would recommend that you bring your own blanket to use. There was a smell in the elevator and the property was ran down. Not sure what they do with the money they make, cause everything is out dated. Rooms need remodeling and new beds I would recommend. Overall disappointed.
Dirty, the tv was broken the entire 3 nights. The breakfast was bad, hard to get in and out of the parking lot. Bad experience. Won't stay there anymore

Summary Heading: My room was near the elevator and it was a bit noisy and...
Summary: My room was near the elevator and it was a bit noisy and difficult to sleep. Overall it was a good stay

Summary Heading: Run down, but close to Disney
Summary: Hotel is old, in need of upgrade, and a good cleaning.  Carpets very dirty. However very close to Disney Land.  Fireworks outside the windows every night at 9:30 is a plus, also the short walk to the parking garage, and tram is a plus. Quiet and good for us since we only slept there. Ice machines both were broken for our 5 days. Good for the price.

Summary Heading: I had called to double check the night befor to make SURE...
Summary: I had called to double check the night befor to make SURE we could bring our dogs, this days inn, asked me to check out because I had my animals. I had to board them which costed me more then the room! The room had ants, bathroom had visable water damage, pool/hottub was a joke, bath water was warmer then the hot tub.

There were little ants in the restroom and sink area, very noisy area. Beds were hard and didn't look like queen beds at all! There was no shuttle from hotel--front office says shuttle is provided by Disney once you walk about 10 mins to the parking structure.  Parking SUCKS!!! Not even really worth the 70 bucks I spent per night!!

This place was so gross. It looks nothing like the photos, it is grungy, rundown and dirty. I had ants in the bathroom and in the vanity area. It was 102 degrees all weekend and the one and only ice machine never worked the entire time. The sofa was full of burn holes. The carpet was so filthy walking from the bathroom to the bed turned our feet BLACK. The tiny little pool dirty footprints. The whirlpool bathtub did not work. The motel offered free continental breakfast, but after seeing the disgusting state of the place we did not trust their food handling practices.

We came here thinking that it was a cheap place to stay that was only a ten minute walk from Disneyland. However, even though the site said it was a ten minute walk and the front desk personal said it was a 10-12 minute walk they were wrong. It took my husband and I about 22 minutes to walk to the park security, which is the first stop to get into Disneyland. WE are fast walkers to begin with so when we found out that it took double the time to walk we figured to drive to the park, since we do so much walking inside the park. Overall, the rooms were average and the breakfast consisted of waffles and cereal.

This hotel is old. The staff is friendly. I did not check how far from DL it was and the walk is far! So if you are used to staying across the street like I am then this place is not for you. Also I had called and asked about a month before my stay of they had somewhere to keep our luggage until our room was ready because we arrived way before  check in and the person said that they had lockers we could put them in until our room was ready. There were no lockers. We had to put them in a room toward the back of the lobby. Overall it was not horrible but I don't think I would stay there again. The walls were dirty, the curtains were disgusting and the towels were super scratchy. If you are on a budget then this would work. Just pay attention to how far you want to walk.
The room was clean EXCEPT for the ants--on the bathroom floor, in our beds.  Breakfast menu choices were very limited.

Summary Heading: We were not pleased with this hotel.  The parking situation...
Summary: We were not pleased with this hotel.  The parking situation is horrible, and the rooms aren't very nice.

Wouldn't have been so bad but we had a giant cockroach in our bathroom the first morning and a few ants also. We were on the third floor so we shouldn't have had a problem. Breakfast offerings were ok the first day but by the end of the stay there wasn't much offered.

Summary Heading: Good value hotel but needs a bit of attention
Summary: We stayed here for three nights whilst got in to disney. The location is excellent just approx 15 mins walk to the park entrance. Breakfast was good with a choice of cereal, toast (white and wheat) muffins and waffles. There is no where to eat breakfast you have to make it and take on a tray to your room which suited us perfectly. The rooms were comfortable and of a good clean standard.  Wifi only works if you go to the lobby, reception in the room doesn't last long.   Plenty of towels and toiletries and comfy clean beds.  The fridge in the room is a good bonus for cold drinks.  There is a swimming pool, it's very small but my kids loved it. The hot tub was cold though. Great value location for anyone staying at Disney.
The hotel was convenient to Disneyland ,  just a right turn around the corner to the garage or you could walk.  It is an older hotel but it was clean and good.

The staff was friendly, the food was good, price was great, location was excellent, and beds and rooms were clean and comfortable. Anyone saying this hotel isn't worth staying at is completely out of there minds.

This place was a good place to stay at but the room is old and sofa bed need to be repaired.  It had a small microwave and a small refrig.  The pool was small and needs to be cleaned daily.  We could only hear the nightly fireworks from Disneyland Park.  Needs to fix jacuzzi.

The room was clean and even though we were very close to a busy road we could not hear any noise in our room. Breakfast only had 2 sugar cereals, muffins, toast and croissants. There was coffee, milk and oj. Wish there would have been some fruit and waffles. Glad the manager told me about taking the Disneyland parking garage tram to Disneyland. It was a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Rooms are clean but dated, Half mile walk to the Tram. We stayed in the 3 Queen room which has one separate room with a queen bed. You can see the fireworks from the balcony. A four star hotel is not but if you want a clean place to stay while at Disney and save some money at the same time them this is your place

I have not stayed in many hotels, but I am completely satisfied with this one. Awesome room, most friendly and helpful staffs and affordable price are the most positive points for this hotel. Only thing that could have been better might be the speed of wifi connection and breakfast options. Other than those this hotel should be the first choice for any traveller,

we stayed in a triple room number 204.We had 3 double beds sleeping  for 6 and we would only get 5 towels. The couch In the room had the springs coming throroom had springs coming  through and you would sink In when you sat. The shower temperatures were either hot or cold. Nothing in between. The carpet was so filthy that we have to wear our shoes inside our room otherwise your feet would turn completely black!. On the last day the toilet started to leak from the tank eerytime you flushed the tank every time you flushed. Upon Chechout  I told the manager he  wasn't concerned. He was only miffed as yo why I didn't repreport the toilet earlier.  I explained it just happented that morning .We stayed4

Summary Heading: Staff was incredible and location was within walking...
Summary: Staff was incredible and location was within walking distance which was a big plus. Unfortunately rooms were not real clean - linens very worn and dingy - headboards broken from frames. Breakfast was big disappointment - only coffee, milk and pastries - expected hot breakfast and somewhere to eat breakfast. Pool and hot tub - no way would we use them. Needs many many updates. No tv in second bedroom.

Summary Heading: The front service was good. the room was okay, there was...
Summary: The front service was good. the room was okay, there was long black hairs on the blankets so I'm not sure how clean they were.The air conditioner in the room couldn't be turned below 72 degrees or it would shut off  the breaker. But its a great location to walk to Disneyland,

When we arrived there was roaches in the bathroom, more than one. The hotel manager said they had never had them be for. And kind of denied it. I said can someone at least clean them. We had not been checked in thirty minutes.

Summary Heading: We took a family trip to Disneyland in February. We loved...
Summary: We took a family trip to Disneyland in February. We loved that our room had two bedrooms and two bathrooms. Breakfast was not the greatest, but you get what you pay for. The carpet was dirty and sticky, and the noise from the street is very bad. If you are a light sleeper this is Not the place for you. The website says walking distance of Disneyland but the holtel staff is not clear in giving directions. The walk to the FRONT gate is actually like 20 minutes. The walk to the parking structure is about 10 minutes. Over all it wasnt bad, but probably would not stay there again.

Since all we did was sleep here and spent all our extra time at Disney Land, it was ok.  The facility really shows its age and wear.  It needs a major face lift.  The outside of the building was just dirty and needed pressure washing.  The elevator smelled horrid.  Driveway was only approachable from the east so you had to drive around a few block to come in from the correct direction.  The manager had no clue how to get to Disney Land.  He led us to believe we could walk to the shuttle and catch a ride.  Yea right!  We ended up walking the 1.8 miles to the park.  Good exercise I guess.  If I go back to Disney Land I will stay someplace that provides a shuttle and hopefully is cleaner.
The room was nice but the noise was loud due to the road so close.  Also beds a bit uncomfortable.  Old spring mattress.  However the room was clean and no bad smells.
Staff was great at check in and check out. Hairs on bathroom walls, we disinfected and cleaned ourself.

Your paying a Four star price for a Two star Room! The price is Hi for what you get! The walk to and from Disneyland was ok but to Enter the Motel Parking lot from the Freeway is a joke. Parking is very limited with no provision for overflow.   I won't be bringing back my Family.

Summary Heading: Most horrific stay of my life
Summary: I like to think of myself as an experienced traveler, and I've been to terrible hotels. But it's the first time I've feared for my life. The mini parking lot is amazingly dark. Movie-like dark. Our room was the last one on the corner and we had to use the car's headlamps to enter. The room was unbelievably old and worn down. So dirty. The door was partly broken and the carpet was filthy. You can imagine the smell. Let's just say that a put a chair against the door to feel somewhat safer. Once we survived the night we immediately went to check out and there, at the front desk, was the complimentary breakfast (which by then had completely forgotten about): some poor quality juice with hard bread and little packet of jam. That was it. We ran out. As fast as we could.  Avoid at all

My boyfriend and I planned a trip to Disneyland for each other as a Christmas gift. We both had a limited budget so I booked a stay here. It was $98 per night and about a 8 minute walk to the parks. The hotel room was "clean" but a bit worn down, the jacuzzi bathtub was a nice surprise although stained had surrounded by a few cracked tiles, the bed was stiff but clean. All in all, the convenience of location and price were worth the drawbacks of a less than fancy hotel room. I would stay here again.
Was not very clean. The air conditioning did not work very well at all. Not much parking and very difficult to get into and out of. Very rundown overall.
I reserved a room with 3 queen beds. I though that the price was okay for being next to Disneyland. The carpet was dirty and the fan. Beds were comfterble.

Only stayed for a night, but regretted it anyway... The place was dirty (didn't step on the carpet in bare feet), and the whole place smelled like mold. I knew that for the price I wouldn't get much, but at least a clean room is what everybody expects... The bed was comfortable and the shower was ok, though I'd rather not use the towel (used anyway, cause I had no choice). The only thing good about it was the location (near Disneyland), but you might think in other options, cause the area has a bunch of hotels nearby.

Summary Heading: Not Much Better Than a Motel 6 but 4 times the price
Summary: The floors were dirty, bare feet turned black. Thermostate was broken and not fixed intentionally. Promised room requests were not honored. All vending machines broken. Beds were in poor repair. Adverstised cable televsion but basically it was priated cable television of only 12 channels, and not even the Disney Channel (and this hotel is right next to Disneyland!). Wifi was offered, but at the speed it was going it was virtually no existant. I had to use the next door's hotel's wifi to get on the intertne. The staff was friendly enough. But the room itself is something to be avoided at all costs. This hotel used to be a go to for me, but no longer.

Plus: Great location Minus: poor breakfast Plus: free parking Minus: broken Jacuzzi Plus: free internet Minus: asked the gentleman at the front desk to fix the Jacuzzi for the next two nights and he said it was fixed. He lied. Big time. It wasn't even lukewarm...

Its close to the bus stop, close to disney, not so many stores around but you probably wont need them because theres so many attractions to go that the free breakfast they give you is enough to start the day. People complain too much about this place but Its actually good.
The location was fabulous.  The staff were very nice.  The room was large enough, however, the carpet turned my socks black.

Summary Heading: Room for 6 adults and 2 infants.  3 nice double beds.  Only...
Summary: Room for 6 adults and 2 infants.  3 nice double beds.  Only issue was an outbreak of ants.  Nice walking proximity to Disneyland and since we didn't rent a car it was perfect!
We are a family of Five... We chose this motel for the three queen beds. It was a little further from Disneyland but worth the walk for better sleep.

This is an older property, and in desperate need of a update and a makeover.  It's not  a place I would ever choose to stay at again, but it worked for our budget.  It's as clean as a place this old can be but the bathrooms are very dark, and the towels were well past their prime.  This place isn't as close to Disneyland as it appears on the map, but there is a ART shuttle stop about a block away.    The breakfast was pretty much muffins, juice and watery coffee, and the beds were strange. One of the two in our room was clearly newer than the other, and I thought that was odd.  There was no HDTV, but since you are probably there for Disneyland, that wasn't a real huge issue.  We were here on our honeymoon and the hotel didn't offer anything and the staff wasn't that helpful on
everything was excellent except the bath towels arent very soft thats the only thing i had a problem with everything was great

This Days in is close to Disney, but you need a car it's a good walk. We only did it once. The room we had needed some work done on it. Wallpaper is curling on the seems and the TV's and cable need updating. The wifi was so slow it was pretty much useless. The beds were great and the room was clean? The employees were all very friendly.
We enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean, the carpet new, and the beds were comfortable. We were glad to have free parking and continental breakfast.

Friendliness/Helpfulness of staff - Very good Quality of maid service - Excellent Cleanliness - Good (note exception below) Convenience - Excellent (assuming Disney is your destination)  The owner/staff were very good.  We enjoyed our stay overall.  The location is excellent, it was a 10 minute walk to the shuttle which took us to the parks.  One complaint I have is with the cleanliness of the carpet in our room.  I doubt I can adequately describe how bad it was.  It wasn't the fault of the room service staff as they vacuumed it daily -- the carpet itself was was absolutely filthy.  It seems that it hadn't been shampooed in a very long time.  I discovered this after scolding my 6 y/o child and accusing her of lying to me about walking in the parking lot with only her socks on.

Summary Heading: Worse place ever I stayed with Emliy
Summary: OMG, This place was so dirty and the bathroomhad rust every where in the tud, Everything in the room was color black even the curtains was VERY flow of DUST and the ROOM smelled once we open the door of the room.. I will never stay at a Days INN ever again...   The pool was GREEN too.. I will be call the HEALTH department for this HOTEL...
Our room was so dirty.  we would take a shower and walk around the room and our feet were just black.   Carpet needed a good cleaning and just maybe some updates to make the bathrooms look nicer
Older building, clean rooms, good value. Within a 1/2 mile walk to Disneyland.  Great view of Disney fireworks from the room. Jacuzzi spa was warm, not hot.  Pool was cold, not warm.

Summary Heading: Place is dirty and old. floors filthy don't go barefoot...
Summary: Place is dirty and old. floors filthy don't go barefoot. Not enough parking if leave and come back late good luck. A bit overpriced for the amenities. Pool and hot tub super small and cloudy. Really the best thing is you can walk to Disneyland and not pay 400 a nite. Looking for a bed and that is it go for it.

This hotel was aweful.  The carpet in the room was disgusting.  I made my family walk around in either their shoes or socks.  The bathrooms  need to be refurbished.   Not sure why they offerred a continental breakfast because the foid selection was minimal and terrible.  The only benefit was the very close proximity to Disneyland.

I arrived at the hotel on Saturday with a confirmed reservation only to find out that the place had been closed down for the last two months... there was not a single other hotel in Key West available so I had to travel all the way beck to Key Largo to find a room at more than DOUBLE the cost. Tripadvisor... you owe me my money back, and the cost if the hotel that I have to find and pay for 80 miles away....       BTW...I thought I had it back coming from Calgary Canada... there was another couple who had the same thing happen to them...they were from Germany!!!!
The room was very old and old looking.  It was clean but there were little things that the management could do to make it look a lot better and really would only be up keep.

The beds were very comfortable, wanted to take them home. However, pool and spa needed cleaning so I did not use. Shower was hard to use and the toilet overran for no reason once. Staff was wonderful and would recommend with just minor upkeep up of the pool/spa.
motel was close to Disneyland but we didn't go there for Disneyland so it was over priced the swimming pool was very small and not clean. spa was also dirty and didn't work.

Summary Heading: Oh my gosh what I have done!
Summary: Lets say I was looking for convenience to Disney, dirt cheap and oh it doesn't how matter how clean is it if I am only going to sleep there. If that was the case this place failed to meet even those standards. Really all I can say is "don't book here." This facility is NOT representitive of the Days Inn franchise and SHOULD not be included on the booking site. Although the motel/room had every single item listed it was either old/ mismatched, misrepresented or just down right disgusting ie pool-gross, ice machine, sinking bed, exterior building and elevator deplorable etc. Save yourself the disappointment; it is not a good value for the money. The room was not worth it even with the stay three nights special. Heads up  the hotel next door was newly remodeled and the pool was

Summary Heading: Nice but carpet is filthy dirty..
Summary: I just stayed at this motel and the carpet is filthy dirty.  I took my shoes off and walked around in the room from the bed to the tv and my feet were black underneath.  They really need to get new carpet not shampoo them.  The tub clogged up when I showered and the faucet knobs made noise when I turned the hot water on.  Stay sumwhere else.

Summary Heading: Average place to lay your head at night
Summary: The hotel was clean and comfortable. It is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland or a 5 minute walk to the trams to Disneyland. The problem with the hotel is that it is so loud - you can hear every car drive by, person outside talking and the fireworks from Disneyland shook the building. If you are just looking for a place to sleep after a day at the park this property will work for you. Also, there are quieter hotels, just as nice and close the park, on the opposite side of Disneyland that are half the price.

Summary Heading: The hotel is old and needs some work done it has the usual...
Summary: The hotel is old and needs some work done it has the usual area's in the bathroom where the sheet rock needs some repairs and the carpet was so old that even thou it was vacuumed and clean on the surface your feet would be black if you walked on it without shoes.

The towels are very hard, old and scratchy.  It would be nice if there were more electric outlets besides one right by the sink.  The bathroom door does not open all the way becuase it hits the side of the sink.  The curtains are so light that the air condition continually blows them upward and people can see in your room.

Only thing this hotel has going for them is being close to Disneyland. When arriving the first thing noticing is a green pool & spa. Going up to the room the floor isn't even level with the elevator. The bathroom has mold on the floor sidings and in the tub. Missing tile pieces from the tub and the vent had 2 inches of dust with very bad dim lighting. My family was there for a week and the maids didn't change the sheets once nor give new towels, we asked! If your looking for a breakfast this isn't the place unless you like actual frozen O.J and tiny muffins.
The location of the property was very close to Disney property.  It was also very close to shopping districts.

Carpets are filthy, towels are sand paper, beds are broke down, pillows are stained, air conditioning does not work, elevator permit is expired, pool is ice cold and dirty! I could go on and on... Find some where else to stay. Its not even worth the price.

Summary Heading: Very noisy. I could hear everything right outside the door...
Summary: Very noisy. I could hear everything right outside the door. The fridge in the room made a funny clicking noise. The shower curtain wasn't big enough to cover the opening for the shower. The pillow were lumpy. The continental breakfast was a sad sight. A gallon of milk and one kind of cereal and a few muffins. Not my favorite hotel stay but it was a nice close walk to the disney parks.

First off our air conditioner didn't work. I went to check out the hot tub and it was ice cold and the jets did not work the pool was dirty and a ice bath. The luggage rack was missing a wheel. The carpets are really bad. Musty smell to the rooms. Bathroom is a little moldy and kinda gross. Beds are WOW!!! REALLY BAD. Dont ruin your vacation stay somewhere else. The staff is very nice but mist likely just so you wont complain.
The room was not attractive. It was in need of repairs, for the amount of money I paid not worth it. The bathtub / shower was peeling. This made it very difficult to use.
We were on a family weekend visiting Disneyland, so the location was excellent. My only complaint would be that the rooms are kind of noisy, since the hotel is next to a high-traffic highway.

It's a short walk to Disneyland. The room was large and the beds were comfy. The room looked clean, until you walked barefoot on the floor. Our feet turned black just walking around the room. The parking lot was very small, barely enough room for our large SUV to park in a spot.

Not the best, nor the worst hotel I ever stayed at.  Price was phenomenally cheap (February stay could explain that), and it was an ok hotel.  Arrived late in evening after a trip to Disneyland, no reservations- really helpful hotel staff got us a room for cheap.  However, the place could really use an update.  I felt like it was 1980 all over again... Clean room, well kept overall, but the "breakfast room" really, really is kinda dumpy and dark.  Pool clean and heated, but tiny. Could well walk to Disney.  So, good value-but not spectacular place.  Which is ok for an overnight stay.

My two adult daughters, my 3 year old grandson and I stayed in this property in Feb 2013 for part of our 6 week trip to the US. While the outside is a little dated and old, the rooms were spotless, the beds were really comfortable, the linen, towels etc were crisp and clean. Very nice staff in office, extremely helpful, easy walk to Disneyland and no problem to arrange other tours.   Would stay again without hesitation - remember this is a bargain priced hotel - but no complaints from us.

Summary Heading: Not the best, not the worst
Summary: This hotel was okay - just okay.  It was a reasonable price, and close to Disneyland (15 minute walk) but I wouldn't stay here again.  The room was small, but clean.  The bed was moderately comfortable, but was maddeningly made with queen flat sheets, despite being a king bed (also - no fitted sheets??).  The whole hotel definitely needed a facelift, but that's not a deal-breaker for me as a general rule.  However, the pool in the parking lot (and no lounge chairs!) and the fact that the showerhead came up to my shoulder at best are a few of the reasons I would choose a different hotel next time I'm in Anaheim.  The hotel desk staff were helpful, and there was an elevator (nice when you're exhausted after a hard day's work at Disney, and when you're staying on the third floor).

Summary Heading: This hotel was a great value however, the beds are...
Summary: This hotel was a great value however, the beds are uncomfortable, the walls are paper thin, the air conditioning did not cool the rooms adequately.  Also, the carpets were disgusting after showering and walking on the floors our feet were black as if we had never showered.  The continental breakfast leaves much to be desired.  If your not hungry then the breakfast is great.  Not real impressed with the hotel overall.  The staff was very nice and knowledgeable though.

Summary Heading: The rooms and the hotel in general were rundown.  The rooms...
Summary: The rooms and the hotel in general were rundown.  The rooms were dim and dingy, the furniture was falling apart, and the pool could hardly be called a pool, it was so small.  The whole thing needs a major overhaul.  Even some general maintenance and repair would help.
