It is clean and you get what you pay for at this hotel.  It's on the cheaper end - but it needs a facelift.  It served my needs and I would return there again - but it's not top of the line.  If a bed is all you seek, this place will do the job.  The rate is about $80+ a night.  But that's cheap in these parts.
hotel not as close to disneyland as advertised still a very long walk.   rooms not very clean and outdated.  price was decent but not a very good 3 night experience.

first we almost passed the hotel 2 times with the little rinky dink sign, then the pool was smaller than the bathtub. they put the smokers on the first floor so the smoke can rise and stink up the other 2 floors. we forgot a baby blanket and of course the housekeepers said they didnt find it now i have a crabby sleepless baby. the walk was ok, but dont let them fool you about taking the parking lot tram, its a farther walk than into dwntwn disney. and the little hill is bad at the end of the day.

I booked this based on some yelp reviews- bad idea!!! The carpet was gross and made my white socks brown within an hour, the shower/toilet area was moldy and the tub was all cracked. The shower curtain was moldy and torn, the shower leaked, the toilet ran all night and the in room fridge was so noisy we actually thought there was a generator running in the next room. My daughter immediately got a rash on her body from the sheets- I'm guessing bleach overload because they certainly were white but were no where even close to feeling like even aged bed sheets. The heater/ac was dated and was so loud and clunky I was afraid to leave it run for fear it would catch on fire! Our friend staying down the hall had a cockroach in her just cleaned room, and she commented that at her height,

Summary Heading: Not the Days Inn I was expecting ...
Summary: The hotel staff is friendly enough, but this property is dated and needs refurbishing.  My room was visibly 'surface clean' but smelled musty.  Parking lot and public areas seemed grimy.  (Management should invest in a powerwasher for the public areas.)    Fresh paint and new carpet would be a start, but the cheap particle-board motel furniture is 20 years out of date and needs replacing as well.  I poked around online and learned that Days Inn is a francise brand system of the Wyndam hotel company.  That means that while the brand name is a good one, this particular property's owners are choosing not to invest in keeping the property up to snuff.  Probably because if its location so ideally close to Disneyland, they can get away with it and must be laughing all the way to the

In planning a last minute trip to Disneyland I had a hard time finding good priced rooms. Our regular hotel was booked. This inn had vacancies and now I know why..it was awful. While the walk wasn't that bad to the Disney tram, the room was nasty, dirty, wallpaper peeling off all walls, rugs smelled, the continental breakfast was the worst thing..the muffins and pastries being served tasted like cleaning products..bleach or pinesol. They put the food in a cabinet and they must clean it out with those cleaning agents...took one bite and spit it right out... Room price was good...so just beware that the rooms are run down and whatever you do, DON'T EAT THE FREE FOOD!

Summary Heading: the location of the hotel was what drew us to this...
Summary: the location of the hotel was what drew us to this location.  The room had a bad oder which they tried to cover with lemon scented cleaner which made the smell worse. The table in the rooms had the "finish" rubbed off, which made the tables sticky.  The bathroom had mold around the tub and the shower head had little to no water pressure coming out.  The beds were extrememly hard and the noise level high, as we could hear conversations of the room next door!!  Being new years eve, there wasn't many options as far as moving rooms or hotels.

The shower head was too low.  The key card reader on our room did not work most of the time. We had to get new keys and even the new keys didn't work, we just suffered standing outside of our room trying over and over and over to get the door open The water dripped in the bathtub all at all times. They ran my credit card, and then after we were already in bed relaxing, the staff called and said that the credit card did not work. I had to get dressed and go down and rerun the credit card it was another inconvenience. I reserved a smoking room, when I arrived there were no smoking rooms available.

Hotel was dark and smelled like cleanser. After keeping the door and window open for an hour it was no better. I understand a clean smell is a good thing bug when we opened the door the family went "ew" and the youngest covered her face.. The staff didn't provide any assistance and we had to leave the next day. They also refused to release the hold on my credit card. Very frustrated and do not recommend. Again the smell was so bad!

The rooms were "cleaned" everyday but the toiletries were not replenished and the bathtub had soap scum on it when we arrived!  The pool and hot tub area were disgusting and the place had a fairly seedy feeling.  We did our best to only be there when we were ready for bed.

We made reservations to go to Disneyland on Black Friday (today 11/23) we had a nice thanksgiving dinner together and then came to check in here for our two nights stay. Driving up to the motel looked sleazy even for being in Disneyland's "back yard". We tried to cancel once we walked into the so called lobby after it smelled of must and smoke. However, David said we weren't able to. We go to our room and it was filthy! Light switch plates dirty, bath tub black, and worst of all...MOLD on the ceiling. I marched right into the office and demanded a full refund. David finally did it after telling us it was "able to stay in". We drove down the block to the Fairfield Inn by Marriott and continued our stay for only...$18 more!! NOT A GOOD PLACE TO STAY, NOT EVEN FOR THE MONEY!! Think

If you're looking for a cheap hotel near Disneyland attractions, this could be your option. The hotel is clean but looks old, you may find something better for the same price. Continental breakfast is better in other same class hotels, and wifi service is terrible.
Large rooms with two double beds. Very well located, close to restaurants and shops and to Disneyland.

Ants in the bathroom and then in 2 of the 3 beds. Carpet was absolutely disgusting! My white socks were black within 5 minutes. Continental breakfast was just some danishes and muffins which were mostly eaten by the staff! The hot tub was lukewarm and dirty. The pool was cold and filthy. The only plus was the proximity to Disneyland but it was still a 20+ minute walk to the main gate. For a little extra I could have stayed right across the street from the main gate. The ART shuttle does not stop at the hotel like it does with the other 2 on route 11.

'CLEAN YOUR ROOM FLOORS' PLEASE they were the filthyest floors i"ve ever seen in any hotel room wash them!!!!!!!!!!!!!The tv remote was not working, the alarm clockradio would not stop buzzing and a little paint wouldn't hurt.  We moved to best western next door, and one out of ten, I rated it a ten. i do not recomend the Days inn to any family members unless i get my money back and an apology to me and my family                                                                       PS         Good thing for Disney Land

Had ants in my room, even in my room but when i informed the clerk up at the front desk he demonstrated no concern. The walls are paper thin and i can hear every little sound from outside and upstairs. Also the tub had a crack and so water leaked onto the tile floor so i was forced to consistently soak the water up.  Spa was broken (didn't heat up at all).Complimentary breakfast sucked! It was nothing more than coffee and two scones.Lastly, all 12 of the channels didnt air anything i was ever interested in.

Location is good a bit difficult exiting to close to traffic light.  Customer service was excellent.  Rooms were confortable and clean.  Very quite considering the surrounding traffic. Walking distance to Disney...that was great !!!!! I would recommend.
If you like walking to Disneyland, that is the best reason to stay here.  The desk staff was friendly.  The furnishings are a bit dated.

The hotel is close to the Disney parking structure.  You could walk to parking and then take the tram to the entrance, but it would be tricky with little children because there are no sidewalks (that's not the hotels fault though).  The bed were comfortable, the room was clean.  Make sure to use the rubber mat for the shower because without they are SLIPPERY!  The continental breakfast was danishes, muffins and toast.  There was OJ and milk, but the OJ was watery.   There is also a pool and laundry, but we did not use these.  Overall, the price was worth it and we would stay here again.

If you're going to Disneyland and don't want to pay parking and don't mind a 1/2 mile walk, this is the place for you!  It's literally right on the corner of Ball Rd. and Disney Dr..  I missed it the first time.  It doesn't have much street frontage ~ 50' MAX.  This creates a problem when leaving the property.  The street has "KEEP CLEAR" in front of the drive way.  However 80% of the time the drivers ignore it.  Room was clean and it comes with a small fridge and a microwave.  The desk Staff are very nice and accomodating and have a lot of local information.
Within walking distance to park and fast food locations.  Ant problem in room that management knew about but claimed could do nothing about it.

Was not kept up as far decor. Wall paper was peelings  off the walls. There were ants in the bathroom. The carpet was dirty and the TV only had 5 Channel . There were no children's channels. The parking was tight .

Parking lot small room was dirty with ants wich they got all.over my things  people next door made lots of.noise towells where dirty not a good hotel when we called they said there was a shuttle to disneyland but there wasnt one that stoped at that hotel so i would not recomend this hotel it was not worth the money

We always try to stay at Days Inn when we go on vacation. Its always a great price and clean. We have stayed in this hotel 2 times now. Its in a great location to walk to disneyland. Thanks for a great trip

Our family trip was planned at the last minute.  Pricing and comparing hotels began less than 1 month prior to the targeted dates.  Days Inn not only had the lowest price available but the stay far exceeded what I had read about prior to leaving on this trip.    The hotel was exactly what was depicted in the ads.  You get what you pay for.  But in our case we were very pleased to have an accessible room which included a working bathroom, in-room amenities - refrigerator, microwave, coffee machine, hair dryer; a laundry room and a continental breakfast.  No it wasn't something most are used to when it comes to "continental", but it did provide a simple enough start for our day.  The area was within a block of the I-5, very close to Disney - we could walk, catch the tram, or

Summary Heading: Not good, but not the worst
Summary: I have syed in a Days Inn in NM. Tex,Arizona, Ca, Georga.  All were about the same price. This one was old and dirty... I took poctures to put on line. If you are interested in my photos I would be happy to send them.Not good place to stay. Water pipes rattled when turned on.

Summary Heading: It needs a good cleaning and updating
Summary: The rooms were large, but we had an accessible room (not by request) and it is close to the parks.   After that, don't expect much.   The carpet was filthy.  Your feet were more dirty when you got out of the shower than when you went in.  Couch has holes and was dirty as well.  We had ants too.  There is really not a continental breakfast.  It was one-gallon of milk sitting out (not even on ice or chilled) a loaf of white bread, packaged patries and mini muffins.  Maybe $10 investment to feed the whole motel.   Also, no place to sit so you had to take it back to the dirty room.   The king bed was comfortable, but we took off the breadspread and placed it on the carpet so we could walk.  sorry for the next people that have to use the breadspread.  There waslots of drawers and

I got this room via Priceline and couldn't stay.  I'm surprised Priceline has them as an option.  When I walked in, the odor was so bold, I had to cover my nose.  I slowly walked around the room only to see a dirty rug, dirty bedspreads and stuffiness.  I was afraid to sit on the bed, so why in the world would I want to SLEEP in one?  I had to leave and checked out within 15 minutes of checking in.  Unless you don't mind sleeping in conditions like this, I would not recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland... that's all.
Summary: The hotel is very old and worn out. Although it's clean, but I think the management can do better by doing some renovation.  There's no kettle in the room. So there's no way to boil hot water. For drinking water, I had to walk across the street and buy from the petrol station's convenience stall. There's a coffee machine  with missing container. I suspect it's broken and never get replaced. When I asked the reception on how to boil water, I was asked to use the coffee machine...  Walking to Disneyland is really not as near as I was told: 10 minutes. I think it's more like 20~25 minutes.  I could have given a lower rating... but this inn has free WiFi and free breakfast. There's also a microwave oven and a 32" LCD TV.  I'm not sure if I'd stay here again... maybe yes, if the room

Summary Heading: Look for alternative, wouldn't stay again.
Summary: We were traveling California on our honeymoon and spent 3 days at Disney.  The positive on this hotel was the walk ability to Disney, this is we're the positives end. The staff weren't overly helpful or forthcoming on advice or information including not being able to answer "where is good to eat?" questions. The rooms are very old and noisy, hotel really needs an upgrade. You get what you pay for, cheap room rates.

Summary Heading: Affordable place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here because the hotels we normally stay at were all booked when we decided to take a quick jaunt down to Disneyland.  We read some of the scary reviews about parking, cleanliness, etc. but didn’t find any of it during our stay.  The staff was very nice and in fact found a necklace of my daughters in the sheets and kindly placed it on the nightstand.  The beds were okay and the shower provided hot water every time we used it with good water pressure.    The towels are cheap and quite hard on the skin but they worked.   The carpet was dirty, but no more than most outside entrance hotels in this area… bring some slippers…   Breakfast was very basic, plain cereal, coffee tea and store provided Danish, and toast.  The AM/PM is right across the street if you need something

When I decided to extend my reservation, Days Inn was great. They let me check in from another hotel at 10:30 am and were wonderful at the desk. The hotel needs an upgrade but it was clean and the people were great. Disney was within walking distance and the hotel was right on the corner.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: My son and I stayed here for 2 nights for a quick trip to Disneyland. Very tricky to find and even trickier to get into off the main road. Had to drive past the hotel, find a place to turn around, then find the entrance, which sits right on the corner of Ball Rd and Disneyland Dr. This place literally sits under the freeway. The room was big enough and clean. The towels were worn and rough. The bathroom old, with cigarrette burns and missing grout around the tub. Also, we unplugged the bedside lamp to plug in a phone charger and found the cord had electrical tape holding it to another cord to be able to plug into the wall!!! On the map, it looks like a quick walk to Disneyland, it's not. We ended up driving both days and paying $15 each day to park. Unless you need the laundry

We stayed in the room with 3 Queen beds, which was spacious enough for our group. There was only one small bathroom, with one sink. As mentioned in other reviews, the towels aren't soft and the carpet is dirty. Since the walls are thin, we were woken up by kids running down the hall early in the morning.The free breakfast was very simple (cereal, pastries, toast, coffee, tea, and OJ). The AC worked well. There was also a refridgerator and microwave in the room. This is a good choice for a family looking for a budget hotel close to Disney. I wouldn't recommend walking, since that is the last thing you want to have to do after a whole day at Disney, but it is a very short drive down the street. Nearby you can find a McDonald's, Burger King, KFC, and more.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here, unless you want to know how cheap prostitutes live.
Summary: This place was nasty. The toilet and shower were dirty.  There was semen stains and cigarette burns on the blankets.  I killed five flys in the room.  Above the shower there was black mold spots and bubbled paint, this was probably due to a roof leak at the bathroom vent. The overall maintenance of the room was very poor. The Wyndham hotel group should be embarrassed.  You should pull the franchise from the owners.

Summary Heading: Ok Hotel. Good location to the park for the price.
Summary: We stayed here while we visited Disneyland. The room was not perfect, carpets were really irty (flip flops will solve this problem) but it was comfortable. The pool was nice to hang out in for a day to take a break from the "greatest place on earth"...(we LOVED Disneyland) It came with continental breakfast, and was a 15 minute walk to the park. All in all...good value hotel. Just don't go bare feet! Oh, and you get a GREAT view of the fireworks they have at night in the park from the balcony of the hotel!! And they have laundry! Plus a convenience store across the road!

Here are the good things about this hotel: You'll be at the park in less than a 30 walk. The air conditioner will get your room nice and cold if you desire. There's a coffee maker in the room.  Here are suggestions to make it better: Downey works great on towels...unless you like to exfoliate after your shower. Pillows usually go on sale during Christmas. The hole in the bottom of the tub its called a drain.  The value is good if you have a tight budget, and walking to the tram is a nice way to save $15 for the three bottles of water in the park for your family. Just bring your own towels. Your skin will thank you later!  Oh...don't miss that right turn into the hotel...it'll take you two u-turns and three lights to get back!

The place looked OK from the outside, but our room was a dump. Bedding was ancient and filthy, Carpet was filthy and smelled awful. Paint was peeling everywhere, toilet was rusting onto the floor, AC didn't work well at all. Even at 75 bucks a night, it wasn't worth it. I would stay closer to Disneyland right across Harbor, as the mile-long walk back with kids is on a very busy road with little sidewalk.   All-in-all, I wouldn't stay here again.

Summary Heading: great value and close to Disneyland
Summary: Although we had read mixed reviews on this hotel, I had no complaints upon our arrival.  It was affordable, clean and comfortable and not too far of a walk to Disneyland.  Every morning we had a decent continental breakfast and the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area.  There was a 24 hour gas station and mini-mart right across the street, which is nice for late-night snacks or beverages.    If you don't mind a pleasant 10 minute walk to Disneyland and you don't want to spend a fortune on a hotel you're only going to spend time sleeping in, the Days Inn West is an excellent choice.

Summary Heading: Incredible value and a very satisfying stay!
Summary: Stayed here one night. Location is right across the street from Disneyland. We had tried the Fairfield Inn to begin with, only to be quoted $160 for the night plus $8 to park our car. Our next choice was this Days Inn property, thinking that it would be the same price bracket as the Fairfield. I almost fainted when the gentleman at the front desk quoted me a $59 AAA rate. Rooms were enormous, clean and extremely comfortable. Hotel is a bit dated, but the rooms looks recently renovated. Breakfast in the morning was a bit weak, but I cannot say anything bad about this property. Excellent value in an excellent location!

Summary Heading: Just what you want for a trip to Disneyland.
Summary: This place is basic, clean and friendly. They provide a free breakfast (Danish, cereal, toast, juice) which is a good money saver. They let you park your car early and then go to Disneyland and check in at night. Ppl complained about the walk, but it is actually quite close. When you walk out the driveway, turn left and head towards the giant parking lot. Go up into the parking tower and down the travelator on the other side. Here, a free Disney shuttle will take you to the park. The rates for overnight are cheap too!!

This was by far the worst Hotel I have ever stayed in.  Hot Tub was not working in the 4 days we stayed there... Pool was not heated at all.. Breakfast was a joke...stale and cheap ! Staff were not helpful at all Not close to Disneyland as Website states...absolute Lie Have to take shuttle $4 to get back and forth Not one restaurant nearby

Summary Heading: Cheper than cheap - website has distorted the facts and lied
Summary: The website for this hotel says it is the closest to Disneyland, that they are a short walking distance from it in fact.  I looked this up on Google Earth and they are physically very close to the border of Disneyland, which may be how they get away with this wording, but it is actually a lie.  This hotel is on the back side of the park from the entrance.   We had expected to be across from Disneyland on the side where all the restaurants and stores are, due to the wording of this website.  Instead, when we needed to go back to the hotel for medications, to rest or for any reason, we had to shuttle each time.   To use the free shuttle buses, you have to walk a few long blocks to get to the parking lot and find a shuttle bus, or alternatively, you can walk two blocks down Ball

I live locally in LA, so I just needed a place to stay after a long day at Disneyland instead of driving home.  I maybe spent a grand total of 30 minutes awake in this place, and for that purpose it was absolutely perfect.  Rooms were completely clean, well maintained, and beds were fine.  If you need a no-frills, no-fuss cheap place to sleep after a long day at the park, this is perfect.  If luxury is what you're looking for.....best to try somewhere else!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Just stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. This hotel basically has 2 things going for it: Location and Price. If those are the top of your list of being important, then go for it. Otherwise if you like any sort of comfort, then  I'd suggest looking around.  The location is superb and it's a really close walk to the park and downtown disney. And from the price I paid I thought it was a bargin to be that close. The front desk folks were pretty nice and helpful. But that's where it ends...  I've stayed at a number of Days Inn before so I'm not expecting anything fancy. But this is probably the most ghetto one I've ever been at. The rooms were kind of dirty, The bottoms of my feet were black after walking around on the carpet (disgusting). The wallpaper was peeling off and just

Summary Heading: Great Budget hotel with friendly staff
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights.  The front desk let us check in 4 hours early.  They were extremely friendly and helpful with any and all of our questions.  It was about a 15 min walk to Disney and the walkway is pretty lit up for your walks returning at night.  The hotel has the best view of the fireworks, but it can get loud if you are trying to sleep at 925pm.  The room was exactly what you pay for.  It does have a refridgerator and microwave which was very convienent.  The floors were gross and my feet were black after walking on it.  Overall GREAT hotel!

Let's start with the parking,if you find a spot leave your car and walk as much as you can. the room in general was fine.Maid service daily. Long walk to any restaurants. lets talk about the continental breakfast, or lack there of. The picture they show us was for advertising only. What we really got was OJ with ice in the container, mini muffins, crescents, danish  in boxes. coffee and frosted flakes cereal.  One gallon of milk sitting on the table to get warm. The news paper was never up to date. The NBA finals and no paper.This was our first and last stay at this days inn.

Summary Heading: Bargain hotel with great location near disney
Summary: Noticied this hotel has had a few bad reviews, but I thought it was good value for money. Cost $50 and room was clean, quiet and only 5 min drive to Disney, so ticked all the boxes for our requirements. Also they had car parking and there was a small breakfast available in the morning.

nasty and old, funky, depressing. dirty looking, awful continental bkfast in office, 1 mile to disneyland, nasty pool and hot tub, needs major work, major disappointment, would never stay there again, you get what you pay for, no tv channels and nothing for kids to watch, no restaurants nearby. just terrible..

I stayed there with family visiting and the place was  horrible.  The pipes were leaking.  It smelled like cat urine.   One of the sinks was clogged and there was no one on duty after 11:00 PM.   There was also no phone in the room.   My husband checked us in earlier that day and just dropped our stuff off in the room, so he didn't realize how bad it was.  We got in late after our day at Disneyland to discover the  problems and no one there to help us.  The carpet was wet from the bathroom sink pipe leaking and when you used towels to soak it up, they turned yellow.      The next day, my husband complained and they only offered us a 10% discount and not very nice about our situation.  We still overpaid for the dumpy room.    We could have stayed somewhere nicer for the price we

This hotel was a typical side of the road drive in motel, which is basic and only made for a few nights stay. We did not have a car, so we had to walk everywhere we went, and found that Disneyland, Taco Bell and Starbucks were within 10 minutes walking distance, and a little further to Mcdonalds and other restaurants. Motel room had a fridge, air conditioner, TV with free channels and phone. Motel had laundry and pool, and 24 hour service station across the road. Although you will find motels which are closer to Disneyland, this one is much cheaper and has everything you need.  DISNEYLAND  Make sure you stay over the weekend so you can experience the exciting fireworks display at Disneyland, which you can also see from the balcony of the motel.

So, I always to research when I am looking at hotels.   I saw that this hotel had a lot of mixed reviews.  We thought we would give it a shot since we were looking to go a little cheaper than usual on this trip to Disneyland.  Check in was easy and friendly.  Not a problem there at all.   Parking can be tight but nothing horrible.  The parking issue is it's a one way in and one way out.  That makes it hard for the larger vehicles to get situated.  If you have a large vehicle, it's best to park towards the front of the property rather than in front of your room.  Once in the back, it can be hard to get out even for small cars.  The property was not the cleanest.  Looks old and neglected.  One soda machine.    We had room 307.  It' was towards the back on the top. Overlooking the
rooms dirty with inside meals of someone else, dirty linens we asked  to change the room but it wasn't possible they give us only some new linens but they didn't make up the beds

I enjoyed my two day stay here.  Most people say you get what you pay for and I was real worried because I couldn't afford much which means I can't expect much but this hotel was a pleasent surprise.    Here the staff (one guy is always at the desk and answered all my reserving phone calls) is plesant and treats you with respect.    The 'breakfast' is just donuts, cereal and juice but what do you expect for the price.  To the entrance of Disneyland is a good walk.  It is 15 minutes if you walk to the parking structure and 30 minutes from the hotel if you walk the whole way to the park.  The hotel is located at the far end of the back of the park.  The fireworks were LOUD but great.  The kids slept nice in their beds while we still got to enjoy the fun from our room.  If you are

Summary Heading: Not too bad, better than had anticipated
Summary: Arrived early in the am, room wasn't ready but was allowed to check in and leave car in the carpark - covered spaces even, a nice feature that even the hyatt and hilton don't offer!  Went and spent a few hours at the park.  While they say they are directly across from the park; which they indeed are; they are on the opposite side of the main entrance.  It is a nice 5 to 10 minute walk.  Another reviewer suggested walking to the parking garage to get the tram to the entrance.  This is much easier said than done as there are no sidewalks to the garage, you have to walk along side the road.  Later in the evening went to see if my room was ready, the man at the desk was the same one when I checked in, think its family run and each time I went into the lobby he was very friendly and

Let me start by saying the front desk staff is incredible in every way. Friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. They were the best I've found anywhere.   Sadly, that's where the compliments end.  Like other guests, we found our room less than satisfactory. The carpet did, indeed, leave our feet black. When I brought this up as I checked out (I didn't bother to mention it earlier, because I was pretty sure we had booked one of just a couple suites, and I didn't want separate rooms), I was told this is because people walk to and from the pool barefoot, tracking in dirt.  Aside from that, our room smelled like urine very strongly when we arrived, but the cooling system took care of that. The shower head in the tub is so low that only my young children could use it without having to bend

I read the reviews on Trip Advisor before booking and felt that it was worth a shot. A previous reviewer had mentioned the floor being so filthy they turned her feet black. This also happened to us. There was a greasy black film on the carpet that just stuck to our feet! The management moved us to a dusty old handicapped room when we complained, but it wasn't much better. I took a picture of my two year old's feet less than one half hour after getting out of the bath. She had not left the room at all. I told the management about the greasy carpet in the second room, but he didn't seem to believe me because "no one ever stays in that room". We did see them steam cleaning the carpet in the room we checked out of.There were also some sketchy characters staying in the hotel. We were

I stayed here on a Friday & Saturday night. What I liked best was how friendly & helpful the staff was. Everything worked well in the room - the TV, the shower, the ac/heater. It had comfortable beds & was very clean (except the carpet, and the wall paper was in need of a little glue here & there). The price was right ($56/night) & I would stay here again. I have stayed at the Parkside Inn & the Rodeway Inn Maingate, & they were just nasty. So it was nice to find a good value, & a nice room so close to Disneyland.

Moved to this Hotel after finding the Parkside Inn too bad to stay in.  I have to say that the Manager is extremely polite and helpful. The room was adequate, not that clean, but not disgusting either with the exception of the Toilet, which needed some Hydrocloric Acid or something to remove the stains, also, the smoke detector was broken and very obviously so.  The room had a fridge and microwave which were very useful and the Hotel has wireless Internet which is fast, efficient and FREE. The Laundry can be a problem, on one occasion it had puddles of water all over the floor, making it a difficult task to get clothes out of the dryer without re-wetting them. Good views of the Disneyland fireworks each night, which we were able to transmit live to friends in Australia with the

Summary Heading: Large, Comfortable Room -- Great Shuttle Service
Summary: After checking all the rates and amenities of the surrounding Disneyland hotels, I chose the Days Inn Anaheim West  since it looked like the best deal around!  I reserved the family suite which consisted of a large room with two double beds and bathroom with an attached second bedroom with a double bed and its own bathroom -- there was a  refrigerator and freezer (which kept my ice cream bar frozen for the following day!) and also a nice microwave -- great for making popcorn! Across the street is a gas station/mini mart.  Hotel guests can purchase a shuttle pass for only $3 per person which is good for all day, back and forth, to the restaurants nearby and/or Disneyland -- which they purchase in the hotel lobby.  The shuttle runs every 20 minutes and stops only a short block

I stayed at the Days Inn Disneyland West and I dont Have any Complaints. It was Extremelly Close to the Mickey And friends parking estructure, Once you access the parking estructure you head for the tram and within a few minutes youre in the middle of the action. I traveled alone and saved a Bundle staying there . I got a nice room, Located in front of the elevator. Very Clean, Very confy, smelled good, shower had a lot of pressure, Lots of towels, nice toiletries, A microwave and refrigerator. I would'nt recommended for a honeymoon or anyversary, because keep in mind that this is a value tourist class hotel. Great for lone travelers like myself, and to travel with friends and family. You can see Disneyland's Beautiful fireworks from the hall.  Awsome staff, one day a tour bus

I was appalled at the conditions of this room! The first room they put us in, the TV didn't have color, so they moved us to another room. We should have stayed in the first one! This second room had the grossest blood stain on the box spring of the bed! When I called to complain at the front desk, they said it was a coffee stain! I think I know a blood stain when I see it! And if they knew it was there, why wasn't that box spring removed a long time ago?! There were enormous water stains on the ceiling and the bathroom sink wouldn't drain. For $100 they have a lot of nerve keeping a place in such bad condition. Would NEVER stay there again! I do have pictures but they are really too gross to post! But they sent me a survey and you better believe I gave them what for!

Summary Heading: OK for the price, needs some updates though
Summary: We all stayed here the week before Thanksgiving.  I have to say, it was quite clean. The beds were actually comfortable, or perhaps I was just really tired when it came time to sleep. My only complaint was the bathrooms SERIOUSLY need to be redone. They smelled of mildew, and the tiles were coming out of the grout that was supposed to be holding them in. (I don't know if all of them are like this, but ours was really bad. Perhaps because we had requested adjoining rooms??) I did have another complaint, but nothing that the management could do about it. The rooms are close to a VERY busy road. You can hear all the noise from the street if you are in one of the rooms closest to the road. I only experienced that one night though. (I heard sirens, a person who almost ran a stop

We frequently stay at budget hotels, but this one was definately on the LOW end of quality.  Rooms were very dingy, kind of dirty, lots of things didn't work, and large gross looking stains on the sheets.  We stayed 5 nights, and it was ok, because by the time we got back from the parks, we were ready to just sleep, but I don't think we'd stay there, again.

We have stayed in this hotel twice over the past 4 years.If you want the a 5 star hotel then look else where but if you want a cheap base for disney and the theme parks then this is for you.Disney is only 5 mintutes away.Disney transport is provided and was alll ways on time and the drivers where all ways frendly.The room had 2 double beds.The shower worked well and there was all ways hot water.When we where there we got a free contenetal breakfast which was ok.Staff where all ways fredly.The only problem was the air conditioner which was noisy.If you have not got a car the lynx bus stopped near hotel which was very good for old kisseimmee.Over all a nice hotel for the price

Had a suite with three double beds. one was in a windowless room. It was very hot as the air conditioner did not reach that part. the hotel staff turn of fans and air conditioners while you are out and so the room is unbearable when you return. Everything in the room is old and in bad need of renovation. On the good side, it was within walking distance of Disneyland and downtown Disney.
